Reviews.Title: “Ended up here by accident tatty room not happy”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsHolidayqueen
Reviews.Content: I booked for 3 nights at Hotel Marconi before problems as outlined on Trip advisor, then read reviews and began to worry. Sure enough turned up having carried cases over Rialto bridge - no mean feat but we were prepared- only to be given the usual bluff "owing to problems beyond our control ...... plumbing.... moved to another of our buildings 15 minutes away" . So we waited to be taken to "other building" turned out to be the Hotel San Moise on the other side of the Grand canal in San Marco. We were told to make up for the inconvenience we would be placed in a superior room, if that was the case I do not know what a good room looks like . At top of hotel up 2 flights of stairs and then when room door opened more stairs, stained carpet, light hanging by a thin wire above head tatty unpainted shutters and mosquitoes. There is quirky and there is grubby and down at heel. This was the latter. On a positive note very near St Marks Square and good for ferry to airport home . If you want to know where you are going to stay do not book this hotel. I often write reviews and have never before felt the need to advise against using a hotel but this experience set a very bad note for our time in Venice. If you book this hotel say no to room 26 . Others lower down in hotel looked better - at least shutters were painted and looked well kept. The location is good as so close to square but that is the only plus. Breakfast ok but no more. "Juice" was concentrate that was then watered down leaving it tasting only of bad cordial. Normal bread croissant 2 types of meat and cheese but not good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and no complaints from us!”
Reviews.Author: 4141alian
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to many cities around the world, for us this hotel was a good little base from which to explore the delights of Venice without that dreadful corporate feel you get in some hotel chains. Our room (4) was a decent double but had an extra bed in for our son. Despite this we managed fine. The room and bedding was clean as was the bathroom and everything worked well. We had clean towels each day. Murano glass lighting and mirror added that Venetian touch. The double was two singles together but ours were very comfortable and we all had really good nights sleep. One of the windows in our room looked over the beautiful canal and yes there was construction going on underneath us but why stay in bed when there is the beautiful city to explore! The construction certainly didn't last all day and when we came back mid afternoon for a rest we were serendaded by the gondoliers instead which was magical. The breakfast was in a room just around the corner and through a courtyard - still part of the same buiding but no access from the main reception due to the canal I think. Breakfast included a selection of meat and cheese, fruit, cereal, croissant, juices, yoghurts, coffee, tea and toast. The staff at breakfast and in the hotel were always very pleasant and helpful. We had taken cash with us to pay for the city taxes up front when we arrived as we had noted this in the research we had done. Any hotel will ask you for this. We found the hotel very easily by printing off the larger map on the hotel website but a word of guidance - when you get to the Gucci shop turn right down an alleyway (if you look up you will see an old lampshade with 'Hotel San Moise' written on it on the corner of the alleyway). At the end of the alleyway turn right again and you are there. It takes approx 5 minutes to walk from St Marks Square. All in all we loved the well healed feel of the hotel and its location was just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_Marcella
Reviews.Content: We had booked 4 nights in Lido at the Boulevard hotel, where after the second night we were kindly asked if we would mind relocating to this hotel. We were a bit reluctant but were assured that we would get a lovely room and paid internet access as well as being in the hub of the activity close to San Marco square. Upon arriving to San Moise we were given a choice of rooms (likely due to cancellations from the cold weather). We were pleasantly shocked to land the very best room in the house: a spacious, elegant suite, crowned with a gorgeous antique Murano glass chandelier and incredible terrace, with full view of the canal and gondolas passing by. The staff at the front desk were quite courteous, accomodating and even carried our bags to the room. We were also provided with a kettle and cups for tea when we inquired. Though we arrived to a blistering cold Venice we were dazzled by the exceptional experience we had at this hotel and will definitely return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, unhelpful staff, don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Hilsandkids
Reviews.Content: My fiance booked a surprise trip to Verona and Venice to propose to me. He'd been planning it for ages and wanted everything to be perfect. Verona, thankfully, was perfect, but the San Moise hotel in Venice was awful and he was devastated. He'd booked a superior room and we were really looking forward to relaxing on our first night in Venice after a long journey on a freezing cold day. When we walked into reception we just knew it was going to be a disaster. There were tacky multicoloured glass light fittings everywhere and the interior was shabby and desperately in need of refurbishment. The room, where do I start? The bed was 2 single mattresses pushed together with a double sheet over the top. They kept separating during the night and we woke up with backache. The bedspread had cigarette burns in it, the floor was dirty and had sticky patches, there were dead swatted insects on the ceiling which had obviously been swatted by some other poor tourist in the summer and the hotel hadn't bothered to clean it. The pillows were still in the wardrobe and we had to get them out ourselves, the hairdrier in the bathroom was broken so couldn't be used, the towel rail was rusty, there was paint peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom and I could go on. We asked to be moved as this couldn't possibly be a superior room and we were assured it was a superior room and they couldn't move us anyway as the hotel was full. I dread to think what the basic rooms were like! The breakfast was basic and stale. We decided not to let the hotel ruin our 2 days in Venice and we had a wonderful time but I certainly would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “""NOT WHAT IT SEEMS" SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: The guy at reception is very rude,he was on the phone having what sounded like a personal call,after our long trip to get to Venice all we wanted to do was get to our room & settle in. He had us standing there for 20minutes & didn't have the manners to apologize for keeping us waiting.All seemed strange that he asked for 3 euro each for VENETIAN TAX that he wouldn't take off our credit card would only take cash???? Made us go get cash out at ATM around the corner. His arrogant,extremely unhelpful and wanted to double charge us for the internet when leaving.I had read other reviews so I was aware that they may try to over charge.(Beware aware) The room was ridulously very very small,had no balcony and no view this was stated we got on our itinerary,we could hear the guest next door urinating in his toilet, and couldn't sleep because we were in the rooms that are situated under the stairs so we could hear the guest above us walking around, the blankets were disgusting and I was itching and my fiance had an asthma attack which he hadn't since he was a child. As soon as we got in the room he felt unwell. There is no housekeeping,sheets not changed and no clean towels,no kettle or tea or coffee nothing. The bed was two singles pushed together extremely uncomfortable,couldn't sleep. Breakfast is a joke, a horrible unhappy old lady that tells you were you have to sit, I looked across the room to see a young lady crying,seeming upset about the breakfast it was old & cheap quailty & watered down. Venice is dirty,it smells the people are rude we had no english speaking TV channels it is a very unfriendly and over expensive place. I wish the place will hurry up and sink that would be the best thing for tourist.It's a money pit they take your money and give nothing back. Beware also if you arrive by train the station makes you pay .8euro to go to the toilet. Disgusting!!!How dare they :( The place has graffiti on everyhting,they must photo shopped all that out. We had to cut the trip short as my fiance was still unwell.Two nights was way to long at stay,couldn't wait to get out off Venice. Love our country Australia, these no place like home. Rob&Lee

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: martindhogan
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what good there is to say about the hotel- it is not where it is advertised- some rooms are around the block, but it is within easy walking distance of St Mark's Square, very dirty, grotesquely over priced, terrible food, rude defensive staff- I could go on, but if you are travelling with children- avoid at all costs. That all said- Venice was enchanting- we loved every minute we were there- and after day 1 just used the hotel as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Small room”
Reviews.Author: MeghanB88
Reviews.Content: We had a crappy small room. The tub didn't drain well when taking a shower and didn't appear to be super clean. We were also awoken by loud construction right outside our window. It wasn't nice to be put in a street front room when there was construction going on :( not happy. Breakfast was fine and the location was pretty central, close to water bus etc. Although it was a bit hard to find!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Charming & Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine817
Reviews.Content: I had traveled to Venice before and this hotel went way above my expectations! If you're looking for a charming, one of a kind, antique, clean hotel room right on the canal with a great location to make the most out of sightseeing around Venice, then I would highly recommend this hotel! If you're not familiar with the area of fully aware of the signs, it is tucked away down a small alleyway, but the building itself is clearly marked. The property fits in just like a typical, colorful, artsy Venetian building and each room in the hotel is unique. My friend and I had a double room that overlooked a charming courtyard where breakfast was served (see pictures below)- it was like we were living in a fairytale room for 3 nights. The hotel is just a mere 5 minutes walking to Piazza San Marco- a must-see attraction in Venice, where the famed St. Mark's Basilica and Doge's Palace are located, to name a few iconic landmarks. It is also very close to Calle 22 Marzo, a main street with Gucci, Chanel, Fendi and other designer shops. Looking to get lost in the city and find a truly unique gift or souvenir? Hotel San Moise is a perfect base for all your sightseeing around Venice. It's just about 5 minutes walking from Teatro La Fenice, where there are opera shows. Gondola rides are right around the corner. Get lost in the winding streets just a few streets over from the hotel and follow the signs on almost every street pointing towards the famed Ponte Rialto (Rialto Bridge). Getting lost in Venice will almost inevitably happen, and it's part of the fun. There are plenty of cute boutiques and shops to stumble upon in close proximity of the hotel. The front desk at the hotel was very hospitable and helpful! They gave us a card with the address of a recommended restaurant about 10 minutes walking away. We loved our dinner experience so much at Ristorante La Feluca the first night we dined there we decided to go back 2 nights later! The service was attentive and friendly and the checked to make sure we were enjoying our meal. We were thrilled they recommended such a great restaurant to us! One of my favorite parts of staying at this hotel was the plethora of options at breakfast! Where most European hotels tend to skimp on breakfast, this hotel does not cut corners with their breakfast. They offered delicious pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, a couple kinds of cereal, cold cuts, and coffee. The buffet was consistently being stocked which was appreciated since the buffet had a tendency to get busy around 8-9am. Overall, if you're looking for a moderate priced hotel with a perfect gateway location, charming, quaint atmosphere with helpful staff- definitely stay here; you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Sightseeing,.”
Reviews.Author: Wanmad
Reviews.Content: Realy beautiful hotel. Like a old house, with large rooms. Big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sanskrit72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The rooms were small but value for money. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was ample. Recommend this hotel for value for money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Venice”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Venice at night after parking the car in Mestre. Got off the water bus and asked the group of police officers if they could give me directions to the hotel, No they couldn't and they had to get back to smoking and chatting on their cell phones. Even with my GPS I could not find the hotel because of the closeness of the buildings. We eventually met an English lady who lives in Venice and she took us halfway there and gave us directions for the rest. The hotel itself is fine, the check in was good and the staff somewhat helpfull. The room was clean and furnished with antiques and the bathroom was quite small and up 5 steps from the sleeping area. The breakfast the next morning was good with a great view down a canal. We were able to check our luggage after check out. All in all it was a decent hotel for the price and would have been fun to find if we weren't so tired from driving. The courtyard picture I saw on Hotels.com looks nothing like the exterior of the hotel so don't go by that

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Jose P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my worst decision for my vacation in Venice and I do not recommend it to anyone for the following reasons. . Employees are louts and challenging . The rooms are dirty and the bathroom is worse. During the night it gets a lot of gases from the street. . During the days that we visit Venice (Nov. 5 - 8) rained and the tide rises a lot while and it is impossible to leave the hotel before 10:00 am and do not expect to receive any help from the hotelâ€™s staff. . The web site is a fraud. Everything they say in it is a lie. Not any fabulous hotel or anything like that. . Breakfast is another fraud. Sucked

Reviews.Title: “RUDE! We didn't even get to stay on our first night!”
Reviews.Author: caroline b
Reviews.Content: OK first off, We have been travelling all over Europe (we are from London) on our honeymoon, and we have taken all our hotel advice from trip advisor. and this is the first time i have felt moved to write a review. Now, we booked the hotel San Moise out of desperation, it was one of two hotels left in Venice (we were booking the night before so fair enough!..) and one of the first reviews we read said 'Rude lady on reception' they were'nt wrong! As we walked through the door we had to wait to be seen as tWhen we werehe receptionist called a very nice seeming quiet American man a liar, when he told her is internet password was not working and that he had'nt been able to use his quota. Then she told us with no apoligetic overtones what-so-ever that our room was unavailable and that we would have to stay our first night in another hotel (which they had organised for us). she then acted like we should be grateful as it was actually one star higher (when we got there we were put in a disabled room that obviously is'nt used often and the shower was broken, we were also asked to pay the 4 star city tax, which we argued against as we had'nt booked a four star!. when we were then kicked out at 11 from the hotel we'd been moved to San Moise wouldn't let us in until 2:30! Then after a rushed check in, when we returned later after dinner we were told off by the man on reception for not leaving our room key with him when we went out! we asked what time breakfast was and he just ignored our question and told us off! Very rude! The room is a good size but very old and in bad need of updating also the bathroom smells horrible (i don't think either of these things are that rare for Venice) But the rudeness of the recpeption staff is terrible! anyway it annoyed me enough to write my first review and to spend their ridiculously expensive 10 Euro charge for 5 hours internet on!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: clonella
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel from reading some of the negative reviews, but like someone else had written - it was like this was an entirely different place than the one these negative reviews had described!!! The hotel was PERFECT for us. The location absolutely could not be beat - literally minutes from St. Mark's Square. And being right on a canal? SO great!!! We could look out our window (we even had a little balcony!) and hear/see the gondoliers going by. Really fun!! But at night with the windows closed, perfectly quiet. The breakfast and breakfast room were super and the staff extremely helpful. And we loved the Venetian feel of the place. And the price? Amazing. Couldn't have picked a more perfect place for our family visit to beautiful Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TanMan1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel towards end of July 2011. The family room was cramped. Another family complained that their room was so cramped that it was dangerous so they moved us in case the authorities visited the hotel. Location wise it is good. But this is a bad hotel to stay in. Luckily we were there for only two nights and that was enough. So for families it is a no no. For couples it may be OK if you are OK with basics and can get out of the room in a hurry if needed! You also need to be fit as most times there are no porters to help with two flights of very narrow stairs. Also so windows look onto scafolding of a building development.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Amy120
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cramped even to European style. It is also very dark and unkept. The rooms needed to be cleaner. The breakfast was the best part about the stay! The hotel is in a very good location if you are spending your time in Saint Mark's Square. I will not stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with yummy breakfast and cheerful waitress”
Reviews.Author: ALHC_Venice2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way. It hides behind a construction site, however, due to this, it does have a wonderful front view where many gondolas are passing by every moment. Very nice breakfast with freshly bake croissant everyday and with different flavor! Wonderful! The room is nice and with good room service as well. However, if you stay at top floors, please make sure you have the strength to carry your begs up the stair in your room! Overall, satisfying stay for 3 nights in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyTwinTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights July 9 and 10, 2011 with our two children. Room was big and comfortable, very nice bathroom with an actual shower and shower curtain ! The breakfast was good. Only negative is that you have to carry your bags up the stairs and we were two flights up. Other than that, great location. Super close to San Marco and the water buses and great eating. Have stayed at other hotels in Venice and would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: Bostonsportsfans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back last night from a 4 day trip to Venice and we had a blast. When we arrived at Marco Polo Airport and got our bags we quickly made our way to the Alilaguna water bus which dropped us off at the San Marco dock---a one hour boat ride which was beautiful. We then made our way to the Hotel San Moise which was a casual 10 minute walk from the San Marco dock. When we arrived at the hotel we were warmly greeted by Artemio and Cinzia who upgraded us during check-in to a Luxury room that faced the canal. The hotel is in a great location with a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and a 10 minute walk to the Rialto bridge. The room had a very comfortable queen size bed and a bathroom that was adequate. We got to bed early the first night and as we fell asleep we were serenaded by the gondoliers whose boats were passing 20 feet below our hotel window. The next morning we got up for breakfast and ventured down to the courtyard where breakfast is served and enjoyed coffee and fresh baked croissants. Overall it was a great trip with a great stay in a great hotel. I read some of the other reviews on this website and cannot believe that we are talking about the same hotel. I will definitely recommend this place to any friends that will be traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “well located.female receptionist unfriendly.excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: anthonyvanoss
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel.Expect to be woken early if you go for a bedroom with main canal view.The modest rooms were perfectly comfortable and spotless. Make sure that what you book on internet actually matches what you get.We received no apology for not getting the room type we had asked for on the first night,the explanation being that the website did not match the hotel's actual specification.The female receptionist stunned all our party by her rudeness and attitude and aggressiveness..something i have never experienced anywhere else in Europe or Asia. She attempted to make up during our stay,but first contact rather soured our stay. The rest of the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MAnanth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during February with two kids, (aged 12 and 14). Like previous reviewer, we were told there was a problem with the heating and we need to stay in a partner hotel. The porter took us there, about 5 mins walk. Next day we were asked to come between 12 and 2. When we came to the hotel our bags were already in the room (108). Regarding the hotel, we donâ€™t have any complaints at all. Staffs were friendly and the room is very comfortable. Very close to St Mark's Sq. Reasonable breakfast and eatable. We would stay again considering the price very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Hobbsy2010
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked this trip as a surprise Christmas present for me, I was so excited to be spending new year in Venice. This hotel was booked due to the location so we could spend new year in St Marks Square, however when we arrived at the hotel we were told there was a problem with our room and we had to stay at another hotel that night. I asked if this hotel was far and was told the porter would take us. Well this hotel was right over the other side and we had to take the water bus to get there. I was not impressed. We then had to get the water bus back to St Marks Square and then back to the hotel after our night out which we had to pay for! When i complained the next day the receptionest was very rude but we eventually agreed to an upgrade as a form of compensation, but after seeing the upgrade i hate to think what sort of a room we were going to be given in the first place! We still had to wait another 2 and a half hours for them to get our room ready, then were told out cases would be brought up to the room shortly, after waiting another 3 hours we went back down and brought the cases up ourselves. This was the worst hotel i have ever stayed in, breakfast was cold and very limited. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, it completly ruined our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: PiaHelsinki
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel with a perfect location near St Marcus. Breakfast was eatable, not great. Staff was allmost nice ;) , polite and very loud allways. If you don't have too high expectations, this is a decent hotel with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: ThePitts
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our 30's and stayed at the San Moise for 2 nights earlier this week. I was somewhat sceptical about going after reading the really bad reviews on here but it was absolutely fine. It's easy to find - get the No 5 bus from the airport to P.Roma, then the Vaporetto to San Marco - get on at the main square (you can't miss it, there's about a million tourists!), walk along the grand canal as far as you can go, turn right at Harry's Bar, left at the shop called 1345 and the over the bridge at San Moise, right at the pharmacy just passed Prada and opposite Burberry. It is down a dark ally but it's not dangerous, and it's lit up at night. The hotel is exactly what you expect from 3 star, it's clean, warm and comfortable. The rooms aren't massive but the bed was comfy and there was a decent shower. All we wanted from a hotel in a city like Venice was somewhere to sleep and shower. If you are overly fussed by fancy hotels then pay more and stay somewhere else but if you are just using as a base it's absolutely fine. The front desk staff weren't overly helpful but OK. The breakfast was your typical continental - Ok but not amazing (however food in Venice is plentiful so you'll never go hungry!). the room was decorated in a typical Ventian style and was really 'chinsy' but it's all part of the fun really! We booked through booking.com and paid just over Euro 100 per night and considering it's a stone's throw from everywhere you cant really complain. Venice is truely amazing and I can never understand why people get so stressed about minor details of how a hotel is decorated or what the breakfast is like - you need to be out and seeing and experiencing this wonderful city, not worrying about what the hotel looks like, just don't spend very much time in it - if you are then you are missing out! The Gondoler ride was amazing, it's expensive and touristy but who cares - you have to do it. The Vaporetto (water taxis) are brilliant and run with military precision. We took a Vaporetto back to the airport which was the best way to end our trip - it takes just over an hour and is really cheap - you can get the blue line and it runs every half an hour, would definitely recommend it. Enjoy Venice, it's wonderful. The Hotel San Moise is fine- it's not fancy but it's a great base close to everything you would ever need or want. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER book with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarrollMaine
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? After having confirmed reservations at this hotel, we arrived and were told we we going to be moved to another hotel -Hotel Ateneo (after dragging luggage over at least three canal bridges). When we arrived there, a family was sitting in the very small lobby who had been told the same thing. Apparently the hotel was filled with people who were shifted there. The room at the Ateneo was so small we could barely squeeze between the bed and the armoire. After spending the night there, we inquired at the desk about why the change was made. A VERY RUDE young blonde woman at the desk was not interested in our plight and told us to "get out!" When we asked to see the manager (numerous times) she refused and then admitted he was not there (or perhaps was hiding out in the back room??). She even threatened to call the police. If I were the manager or owner of these hotels, I would find someone with better people skills to be at the front desk. We returned to the San Moise, received an equally rude response and were told that they had the right to "substitute" a different hotel for the San Moise, plus we would have to pay for two nights at that dump with the blonde monster. We found another small but charming hotel around the corner and alerted our credit card company about the situation and will contest any charge for a second night. The whole experience was awful.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BE FOOLED... please don't ruin your trip to Venice and stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aliciajones
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotels.com after looking at their website. We arrived at the hotel and the front desk clerk said she had an "upgrade" for us..... yeah right... we were seriously in the attic (we had 2 rooms with 2 people each) the room was not clean at all and I didn't even want to sleep under the covers (my husband and I both got bit by something that night and now itching like crazy" The king bed is really 2 twins put together and when you turn over at night the come apart! My husband is 6'3" and he couldn't even stand up in the room because the beams were so low... oh.... and to put the icing on the cake the front desk told us they were oversold the last night of our stay and we had to move to a differnet hotel. When I told her how unhappy we were she "really cound't do anything"...... I called Amex platinum service crying and they booked us a room for the next night at St Clemente Palace for the next 4 nights... it was WONDERFUL and to beat it all cheaper than this so called "hotel". We own a resort in the states that is "3 star" and if this was 3 star our restor is 5 star!!!! I can not express enough how horrible it was and when we return in October I will post the pictures I took... the website is total false advertising......

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: granitepeaker
Reviews.Content: So the most important tip I can give you about this hotel is to make sure to book the upgraded vip/luxory room otherwise you risk them bumping you to their sister hotel near the Rialto bridge. We had a spacious room with canal view and a balcony. The only fault I can give this room is that the mini fridge never got cold and the hideous murano glass chandelier. The breakfast was very good and the hotel had a pleasant courtyard area. Best perk of this hotel is closeness to St. Mark's Square. Since we had an upgraded room we had a free bottle of prosecco, but it was very small in size. Also free access to wireless internet, but very slow in speed. Overall, ... would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but left something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: Bdamsel81
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the last top of our 12 day vacation through Italy. The location was great, just a 5 minute walk from the San Marco stop. Yet, upon arriving the woman the desk wasn't very friendly, or helpful with our questions. When we eventually got into our room, it was small but sufficient. In the bathroom there was a wierd blackish mold by the ceilings and you could tell that their cleaning wasn't the best. Yet, we were at the end of our trip, had stayed at a place worse than this and were not hardly in our room. It was 5 euro for one hour of wifi, which we did not purchase. When we asked for the best way to get to the airport, all they recommended was private taxi, which would have cost us $150.00. Instead, we asked around and figured out the public boat schedule, and took a leisurely hour trip from a nearby stop to the airport, which only cost us 32 euro instead! If you stay here do not bother asking for resturant suggestions. The only place they told us about for lunch was a specific resturant that they obviously get a kick back from, or something. So, for all of the other meals we figured it out on our own. I'm not sure that I would stay here again, but the location is good if thats your top priority.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Jacq16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square. It's position is next to a small canal where lots of Gondolas go by so it was nice to sit outside watching them all at night. The room we had was very big and was kept very clean by the staff. The breakfast was nice and the reception staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Below Average. Stay away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deepakmalik1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in beautiful Venice in this ugly hotel where everything was disappointing. Location was not great. Staff was not helpful, breakfast was the worst spread that we saw during our entire trip to Italy (Florence, Rome and Sorrento). No value for money. Small room size. seemed like someone had converted an old house into a Hotel with some reminders of the fact that it might have a rich person's house which is now quite unkept - there were mosquitoes in the room with dead ones (squatted) on the walls While there was a porter to take our luggage to the 2nd floor room during our arrival, on our return, there was none and it was a big problem with their steep steps One should not go by the picture on their website - TOTALLY AVOIDABLE PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “There are better offers for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: Manuel045
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very different from the pictures. We made our reservation and paid with 3 months in advance, and when we arrived they changed us to another hotel. Small rooms and bad costumer service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, standard rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: stokesmole
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Moise, despite being in the hustle and bustle of San Marco, is located on a quite side street terminating in a canal - a beautiful, tranquil spot. I think the thing to do is NOT to book the standard double rooms, but pay a little more for something bigger. Apparently they do have some lovely, bigger rooms, higher up the tariff scale, but our standard room was tiny and still not cheap at around Â£100 per night. Travelling with anything more than hand luggage would be impractical in one of these rooms - there is really barely room for a suitcase. Rooms are traditionally and well-decorated, however. On one occasion at this hotel we were treated extremely rudely by the staff member on reception - on our first night we forgot to hand in our room key when we went out. When we returned, instead of simply explaining what we should have done, the guy on reception was extremely rude and sarcastic. However, staff were otherwise fine. Breakfast is good - quite plentiful, with a a good selection. Do not buy the one hour wifi access tickets - either there is a fault with the system or they are a scam - wifi access always terminated before a full hour had been accumulated, when we bought these. Maybe the 5 hour one is a better bet... This hotel is worth considering if you manage to get a decent room. My general feeling, however, is that it's so hard to find value for money in San Marco, and Venice is really quite small and walkable, and all of it is beautiful, so next time I'd stay oustide San Marco and find better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Traditionally designed”
Reviews.Author: goldigol
Reviews.Content: Staying in San Moise Hotel is a real adventure. Though I travel a lot, it is quite seldom I bump into hotels such as this one- so traditionally designed, so authentically kept. Its wonderful internal design and the amazing view seen from its windows are truly one of a kind. Still it wasn't expensive at all-I paid less than 80$ for a double room (through easy click travel web site). Amazing, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “first impression was really bad, but settled in okay later only because i was working and didn't care.”
Reviews.Author: scdangcil
Reviews.Content: I actually read before about this place when checking in that someone else too had the same problem and this was that when you checked in that they pushed you into another hotel of theres, i guess because the one you saw on the internet was overbooked. I was pissed that it would happen to me too, i argued with them and they didn't budge and made me feel that i was doing something wrong asking for the same location that i booked online, all the nerve. it would be different if they said that they have two locations and if overbooked that they would move you to another location...but, how many people would book then? answer...very, very few....i also happened to be working a big celebrity wedding close by the hotel so i needed to be close and then when they moved me 4 street farther it really pissed me off, but i couldn't do anything about it and settled for the sister hotel.....bottom line, bad feelings towards them and wouldn't book again...I can't believe they asked for a rating, tells you how backwards they think....chao

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent and beautiful hotel in the very heart of Venice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlbaMoscow
Reviews.Content: People who wants to stay and enjoy Venice in a very cozy,wonderful hotel,old styled with great location-2 min walk from plazza San Marco should definately love this wonderful hotel.It has big rooms with high ceilings,very clean bathrooms,exellent breakfast,friendly staff and good service. We felt ourselves like princesses when we first entered our gorgeous two-leveled room with beautiful wooden stairs and colourful chandeliers and lamps made of famous Murano glass.We were happy to find nice inner yard where we could seat and enjoy our evenings after long sightseeing Venice tours. We will choose hotel San Moise to stay at for our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location....nice Venetian hotel on canal...so, so close to St Mark's”
Reviews.Author: europaolo
Reviews.Content: What a location ! On a side canal with passing gondolas just 30 metres to the 'designer strip' and a further 3 mins. to St Marks Square. This is such good value for a hotel this close to St Marks. The room was a little small but oozed that Venetian style with matching ,ornate Murano glass chandeliers in each room as well as throughout the hotel ! Had fridge and great sheets in comfy bed; bathroom small and no lift.We looked out our 2 windows down to a canal and went downstairs to breakfast in nice basement rooms that looked straight out to the canal just above water level...great sight!! The breakfast was OK by Italian standards with a fair selection - still no hot food and no juice (like sweet cordial) Outside furniture a bit plain - needs some doing up. What a p[leasure it was to walk a short distance to the 'designer shops' street (Calle Larga XXII Marzo) and on to St Marks Square in 5 mins. or Rialto in 12 mins. What a joy to be in this unique and fascinating city at a time of the year when the crowds are not unbearable and the weather was perfect !!A wonderful memory for my wife's birthday. A huge recommendation is the restaurant: Trattoria alla Madonna for lovely, real Italian food where the locals eat. It is tucked away near the Rialto bridge just off the Riva del Vin, but worth the search....superb and not expensive.Also dont miss the Ca' Rezzonico museum....wonderful palazzo done up as it was in the 17th century.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: ME2010
Reviews.Content: The San Moise is a good base for exploring Venice, easy walking distance to St Mark's Sq, and the main vaporetto stops, while restaurants and bars are also nearby. Breakfast was nothing special (pretty boring and downmarket quality in fact) but there was plenty of it and the wait-staff were pleasant and courteous. I had 2 stays within 7 days (once with a friend, once alone) when the bedrooms/en-suite bathrooms I occupied were well-appointed, clean, with comfy beds. Bathroom No 2 showed obvious signs of wear and tear although this didn't get in the way of using the facilities in any way. I thought the hotel was good value for money. I'd happily return to the San Moise!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Belgradeadvisor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent nice 5 days in Venice in this hotel. It is good value for price. Location, in my opinion can`t be much better. Room was very small but clean. Breakfast was nice but it could be better. I would recomend this hotel to young people because it has sharm and in it, you have feeling of real Venice, as you imagine it.

Reviews.Title: “I felt very welcomed”
Reviews.Author: hosentaschenkasper
Reviews.Content: This nice little hotel is good situated and easy to find. The rooms are small, neat and comfortable. I had all I need. The breakfast was o.k., the outlooking on a canal with passing gondolas was overwhelming. I would like to come back!

Reviews.Title: “charming views”
Reviews.Author: jcstadams
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a building around the corner from the check in/lobby. Walked through a key/buzz in entry into an old charming courtyard then into another 16th-17th century building. Large room with bathroom for family of 3 adults. Threw open the grand balcony window and had mini balcony with wonderful canal views right below. Very close to St. Marks and high end shopping. Breakfast included. WIFI worked intermittently in the lobby only. Enjoyed our stay. We are return visitors to Venice but our first stay here. We are typically out all day and night using our room only to sleep but it was nice to come back to the canal views especially in the very early am.

Reviews.Title: “Utterley Romantico!!!”
Reviews.Author: rosewoodcot57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this lovely little Boutique Hotel just one year ago... for my birthday celebration... We were blessed with an excellent room, overlooking a calle where the gondoliers sing as they glide past... The deal included a fully cooked buffet breakfast, that truly was a sumptious feast... I've never enjoyed this kind of ample supply in Italy 'for breakfast' before... The room was lovely and clean, spacious and very decadently decorated... An amazing Murano Glass chandelier hung from the centre of the room, that typified the elegance of Venice... The staff were friendly and courteous, and very helpful in recommending places of interest, etc.. Once we had initially found the hotel, it was easy to re-locate, especially as it was in close proximity to San Marco... In short... a wonderfully memorable getaway, and would thoroughly recommend this lovely establishment to any wanting 'that little bit extra' in a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT little hotel, EXCELLENT free breakfast, BEAUTIFUL rooms, ZERO complaints”
Reviews.Author: bluelikejeff
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were doing some traveling while on break from college. We didn't want to spend a lot but of course wanted a decent hotel in Venice. San Moise was perfect. We felt like we were in a 5 star hotel. The room featured crown molded ceilings, a beauitful bathroom, LCD tv, and a view over one of the canals (and we paid whatever the lowest cost for a room was at the time). Breakfast was included and incredible. Not just pastries but a full hot breakfast in the hotels parlor. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy_in_Venice
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is amazing: 1) Location: in the heart of the city, just 5 minutes most of the main tourist attractions such as St Marks square and brigde of sights 2) The rooms were very clean and elegant. The room was decorated to very high standards with beautifull Venice furniture. A very romantic room. No noises from outside and if we were not in such a beautifull city we would stay in the all day. 3) The best breakfast I ever had in an hotel. Fresh fruit, yogurts, cheeses and cold meats. Amazing coffe, not forgetting the great thick italian hot chocolate that was being brought to your table. 4) The hotel staff was extremely helpfull and gentle. always ready to help you to find your way around town and proving usefull suggestions. 5) Easy acess to internet. 6) Easy acess to the main transports. The best hotel ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Purely decadent”
Reviews.Author: SurreyMango
Reviews.Content: You may say that I only felt this level of decadence due to the fact that I had been travelling around europe in budget hotels and hostels - and this was my last stop. But I tell you, for something that was meant to just add a little bit of pampering, i felt it added quite a lot. Not only was the room absolutely lovely, the bed comfy and the staff attentive, but the breakfast was lovely, the location great and last and most importantly, the bath was fabulous! - a jacuzzi! with alternating lighting :). I cannot complain.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay in the "San Moise"”
Reviews.Author: PortDirector
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in for two nights (#104) was horrible. It was approx 10' X 12' with a 7' ceiling - almost like a dunegon. I complained to the front desk. I had booked this room three months ahead. They stated that was the only room they had available. basically - "TAKE IT OR LEAVE". What was I supposed to do in a foreigh country - no transportation. So we took the room. We were promised a room with a view of a canal - all you could see from our window, was a brick wall. They have beautiful pictures in their ads - don't believe it.... We had a constant problem with sewer gas coming from the bathroom - I complained a number of times, to no avail - the only way to keep the smell down, was to leave the water running slowly in the sink & tub. I forgot to mention the price - aprox. $350.00 per night. Ripped off!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Resgurun
Reviews.Content: I guess its very hard to find a nice hotel in Venice for a reasonable price. We had a great discount because of low season, but I would never stayed in this hotel for full price. The room was so small that it just space for a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, Pricey address”
Reviews.Author: Avisen
Reviews.Content: We liked the atmosphere, the location and the peacefulness. For our 3-night stay (a long weekend) the hotel was quite suitable. The room was clean, comfortable, in ancient style, with very old wooden beams on the roof, though conveniently renovated; however, it was much too dark, with barely any natural light inside, which made it rather oppressive. We also regret the fact that it was impossible to get any kind of drink in the evening, as we were told at the reception, not even boiled water to brew our own tea, not even from a dispenser. We know that Venice is a very expensive city, but still we consider the San MoisÃ¨ to have a rather low value for money (Eur. 200 per night for a double in mid-october). That would be the only reason for trying something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “On the Whole - OK!”
Reviews.Author: Net_Fisher2
Reviews.Content: Yes, we got moved to another Hotel for one night, but then moved back for the rest of our stay, in to a nice room over looking the San Moise canel (Room 105 - Recommend). They moved our cases for us...so not a problem...Moved to the Ca Fortuny (a sistor hotel) for the first night which was small and know one on recp after 6:30pm...keys to doors given. Depends what you are after, if you want to have a good break then go with the flow.... If you dont want to enjoy then moan about everything that happens!?! I have stayed in many hotels all over the world, this rates in the good list! Breakfast was good! Security is good! Rooms were OK! Took the Gold line water taxi from the airport to San Marco Piazza, the fast direct one...which places you very near the hotel.... TIP Do not take excess baggage, you will only have to carry it over the brigdes! Or you can pay circa 100 euros for the fast personal taxi direct to the door (we took this back to the airporrt)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beaupink
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Charming 16th century palazzo near the grand canal

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Minda84
Reviews.Content: This hotel had larger rooms and better bathrooms than we had expected for the price. Hotels in Venice are extremely expensive, so this place was great value. The location is excellent, very close to St Mark's square. However we did have trouble finding the hotel when we arrived at about 10pm. The street numbering is very confusing in Venice. Once you find the right street, it's actually down a laneway on the right hand side, and then turn right again. A decent breakfast was included in the price. WiFi time could be purchased from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and room”
Reviews.Author: Gigi2960
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We had no problem with checking in. They didn't try to change our room or hotel. We booked through Orbitz, and maybe that's why it was smooth. Our room was small, but very comfortable. The towels were great. They also put a lot of towels in the room, and were very prompt in bringing us new ones when the maid forgot to replace them. Our air conditioning was great. The location of this hotel is also very good - a 2 minute walk to St. Mark's square. The designer shops are all nearby, and there is a small, quiet canal right out front. This hotel was so much better than the one we had booked in Florence. It's 3 star rating is definitely deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away at Every Cost!!”
Reviews.Author: olszeric
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel as I write this review. We first arrived very early 10:00AM (due to our train arrival schedule). We went to the hotel to check our bags with we had no problem. The desk clerk said check in was at 2:00PM. We did some sight seeing and came back to relieve ourselves from the heat around 1:00PM hoping the room would be ready early. While we were waiting there were two other couples waiting for their rooms (we all looked very travel worn). The desk clerk waited until exactly 2:00PM to begin the check in process. Wouldn't you think from a customer service prospective if the rooms were ready, he check us in?? Next, we get to the room and I resembled nothing like the photos shown. The room was very, very small. I swear I had more room on the overnight train I took the night before. The air conditioning is terrible. Although the weather was in the low 90's (f), the a/c barely kept the room below 80(f). The hotel does not have any ice what so ever. The bed is like sleeping on a rock. There is no room inside the room to sort your luggage. The TV is a small 14in model that only gets one english speaking channel. The tub in the bathroom is a 3/4 size bath from standard size. The refrigerator in the room didnt work very well as the drinks were barely cool. The decor is dated and worn. The property was not very well kept. I would look elsewhere for accommodations. We have checked into another hotel for the remainder of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “something to see on its own!”
Reviews.Author: saraholy
Reviews.Content: We originally reserved the Hotel Ateneo, but they changed us to their sister property, the Hotel San Moise. We could hardly believe our luck. The building must be an historic mansion from the 18th Century or so. Our room had 18' ceilings (or so), tomato-red marble walls, marble floor, gondoliers going by on the canal outside our window, and an incredible, giant, gaudy, venetian chandelier at the center. Everything else was quite modern, wi-fi available, a beautiful bath. The soundscape of the canal and the gondolas was wonderful. It's a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, which is great at night. The cafes hire musicians to play on the square, and the crowds are gone. What a fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: brandspands
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel were comfortable, clean and nice. The hotel was situated in a great location, walking distance from the Basilica di San Marco and another attractions. Our room was equipped with a television, air conditioning and mini bar. The free breakfast had the best selection of our whole trip â€“ an assortment of croissants, breads, cheese, meat, canned fruits and dry cereals. The dining room has a quaint view of the waterway. The hotel staff was not very accommodating, so definitely have your own plan for accessing the internet and other services you feel you might need.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Good Find”
Reviews.Author: natalievi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew to Italy with no reservations. We found this hotel through lastminute.com after we arrived in Venice. It was the cheapest with the best location. We weren't expecting much but when we got there and checked in, we were pleasantly surprised. It was a little hard to find since it's through an alley way, but it was great. The room was smaller than usual, but it served our needs. We wouldn't be spending much time there anyway! The staff was nice. The room was clean. I would definitely recommend it for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “If moved to CA Fortuny - Small But Lovely.”
Reviews.Author: SJBerkshire
Reviews.Content: The Ca Fortuny is a sister hotel for the san moise, and people get moved on check in to the Ca Fortuny. It's small only about 15 rooms. No reception service from 8pm till the next morning. No bar and only a breakfast room ensite. Location is great, very central - 5 mins from Rialto and St Marks Square. Lots of bars, restaurants around. Also 1 min from the Vapretto stop for the airport. Our room (103) was fine, very clean and great bathroom with jacuzzi bath - came in handy during the floods and walking in 1ft of water to hotel...! Kettle in room too which is unsual for Europe. Mini Bar very very reasonable, only E2.50 for a beer, compared to wine bar across road which charges E5..! Breakfast was good too - continental style but loadsa choice and replenished quickly. Staff were great, friendly and offered good service, nothing seemed to be a problem. Overall a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not neccesarily the Hotel you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: rene_555
Reviews.Content: After reading other comments where reviewers state the hotel send you off to thier sister hotel, my partner and I were adement we wouldn't be traipsing off anywhere but to our own hotel room within Hotel San Mosie! This was however not the case. On arrival, (by the way we found this by luck within 10 minutes. You might want to phone for exact directions as venice hotels are impossible to find. Another couple we know took 2 hours!) we were met by a friendly recepetion lady. All was fine until the phrase we were dreading came out "This man will take you to our sister hotel where you will be staying" We point blank refused. We said we had paid for that hotel and were staying there. The freindly woman did not stay friendly lets put it that way. After about 15 minutes of argueing, she agreed to let us see a "standard" room in that hotel and then we could decide whether or not to go to the other hotel. We were taken to a room which was literally a single room with a squashed in double bed. It was a ridiculous size! We agreed to go to the other hotel with the porter. (We did not let him carry our bags as know they charge for this without warning.) On arrival we were met by another reception lady who showed us to our "standard" room. I have never seen anything less standard in my life. They basically gave us thier biggest deluxe room available and posed it as a standard. She kept repeating (without us asking) "this is standard, you pay no more." We moved. Safe to say, if they don't want you in that hotel, you wont be staying. When they ask you to move, kick off a little and then agree to see both hotel rooms. You will find you are offered the worst hotel room available in the first, to then compare with the best available in the other hotel. (Dont be too rude though, just make your point.) Hotel san moise claim the hotel is "the same" (see how many times you can get the receptionist to say this. She must have said it about 35 times to us) It really isnt. It is not on the same street like they claim, but it is only about 4 minutes different. If you get a better room out of it. It is worth the move! (Read my other review for the Hotel Ateneo) Hotel San Mosie itself if you do get to stay here, is a very good location. (So is the other however) It is 5 mins walk to San Marco square. Private water taxi gate. Clean, tidy. And I guess the other rooms will probably be more adequate than the one we were offered. Nice furnishings. Just a tip. The hotel they moved us to was hotel Ateneo. But these two hotels are part of a chain and when we got to that hotel, guests were also being moved to other hotels in thier chain. Beware that the hotel you book with that hotel network may not be the one you are staying in!

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: gillandalex
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, our room was great and had great views over the canal. The room was large, clean and the tea and coffee making facilities were really welcome after a long day sight seeing. During our stay Venice was experiencing high tides which meant that the street outside the hotel was under water twice a day. Thankfully the hotel provided wellies! Brig your own if you go in Feb!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/pity about the reception staff”
Reviews.Author: MariahBelfast
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great location just around the corner from St. Marks Square. Fantastic breakfast with good choices and staff were very helpful. Bed was very comfortable and room was cleaned daily. Make sure if you have an early morning departure to tell reception. We didnt know this, and when we tried to leave at 6am the treatment we got from reception was unbelieveable. We prepaid through lastminute.com and got a voucher to give the hotel, but apparently the hotel could not find it and it was holding us back for our flight. In the end he just threw his hands up and let us leave telling us he did not know if we paid or not. What a way to finish an otherwise beautiful break. Very expensive so bring plenty of euro!!! Fill up on breakfast as eating out is very expensive as well. We paid 4-5 euro for a coffee. Toilets cost 1 euro so go before you leave. Found the italians very friendly and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to the mark......”
Reviews.Author: janemcnally
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Moise over the new year period. The hotel was quite expensive (240 euro per night) but then again this was New year and this is Venice! On arrival we were informed that the room we had booked was not available and that we had been 'upgraded' to one of the executive canal view rooms. The room was quite impressive, spacious and nicely decorated with a huge murano glass chandelier over the bed and with delightful views of the canal and passing gondolers. The down side of our stay was to do with service in the hotel. On a particularly cold night we returned back to our hotel from a days sightseeing and requested tea or coffee from reception only to be told this was not possible as there was no porter and the kitchen was closed (it was only 8pm). The desk clerk suggested we use the kettle in our room....what kettle? we replied. The clerk informed us our room should have facility for making hot drinks. I then asked him if he could therefore supply the kettle and some tea etc. we waited an hour and then the said tea tray arrived.......without milk and with only a few herbal tea bags. We rang reception again only to be told milk could not be supplied, the kitchen was closed......blah, blah, etc etc.......... The following day we discovered that the heating in the bathroom was not working, rang reception again and a man arrived and proceeded to clunk around with a screwdriver for two minutes and then leave.........heater remained broken for the whole stay. On checkout, we noticed an extra five euro added to the bill for 'room service' this was for the tea tray that should (I presume) have been supplied in the first place. Breakfast was just ok, the usual buffet/ continental style with a small selection of hot food, hot dogs, scrambled egg etc. BUT be warned the breakfast room is VERY small and if you time your arrival wrongly it can become some what of a bun fight!!!!! I realise that my comments sound like 'niggles' but feel strongly that if you are paying nearly Â£1000 for a short break at a hotel that lacks any service and real facilities at all that in future it may be worth checking out other accomodations with more extensive facilities. The San Moise seems to be more like serviced rooms rather than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Same old trick”
Reviews.Author: CairoEdward60
Reviews.Content: Same old trick , I arrived in the hotel after a long train trip from Rome. The unpleasent person at reception told me that they will put me in another building few minutes away from the hotel. When I told him that I know the trick , I read about it in the reviews about the hotel. I told him that he was lying and that he wants to move us to a differrent distant hotel which is not what we booked. He then admitted that it was a different hotel but with the same owner. I told him that I dont care about the owner and that I booked a specific hotel and the owner has a hotel in Cairo he can not put me there! he told me that he has no other option . I asked him to call the maneger or senior but he replyed that he cannot reach any seniors now and I can do what ever I want and he was very rude. At that point I was forced to threaten to call the police and I told him that some body has to stop them . He started to make fun of this and he said, and you think that you are the one to stop us. I told him yes and I have nothing else to do tonight except teaching you a lesson not to cheat on your clients. I asked him to call the police. At this point he turned into a different person and at last started to apologise, he phoned his senior and he gave me the room at San Moise !!!! I travel a lot round the world and I never saw any thing like this.I felt I have to report this to some authority. If any of the readers can advise me how to report this place to stop them from cheating .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinci_travel
Reviews.Content: We started our trip to Italy at the San Moise and were very impressed. Very convenient to Piazza San Marco, it was a perfect place for our family. We were travelling with our children (11 and 8) and the San Moise was one of the few hotels we could find with a quad occupancy room. Our room was very "Venice" with a Murano chandelier, parquet floors, brocade draperies and bed spreads. The bathroom was small, but serviceable and impeccably clean. Our favorite part of the room was the tiny flower laden balcony which overlooked Piazza San Moise and one of the main gondola loading points. We sat to people and gondola watch for what seemed like hours. Breakfast was tasty with a very wide variety of European and American choices, and an espresso bar. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, we loved our experience at the San Moise.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Kando51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the San Moise with my wife a three children (19,17& 15) in two rooms. Parents room was cosy with a mezzanine floor for the sleeping area. The children's room was simply huge with opulent finishings.Great location, great rooms with that "Venice feel" Easy to get to from ferry and good access to St Marks and other delights in this area. Very good value compared to others in this area. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hotel San Moise!”
Reviews.Author: MofromMass
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, the room we stayed in was wonderful (room 102), the staff was very friendly, the rates were reasonable, and the breakfast was the best of all of our hotels in Italy. (the view from the breakfast room alone is worth the visit). We loved Venice and would definitely stay at the Hotel San Moise if we're fortunate enough to return!

Reviews.Title: “Charmless”
Reviews.Author: madamestation
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a famiy holiday in Venice where we stayed at this hotel. Its in a great location and tucked away from the main bustle. However there is really not much else going for it. The rooms were incredibly overpriced given the level of service and quality- our room smelt of damp and was very cold. The staff were generally unfriendly and unhelpful, especially over the lack of heating. And to top it off we were seemingly ripped off by the hotel when we asked them to order us a water taxi back to the airport on our last night (on their suggestion). We later found out they added an extortionate rate- a 15 minute taxi ride was charged at Â£80; far, far more than the usual fare. Hardly a case of looking after your clientele. Venice however was as always beautiful, magical and made up for the hotel though I would not recommend this to anyone unless you like being taken for an expensive ride.

Reviews.Title: “From Bad to Worse”
Reviews.Author: eucalypt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central location just off San Marco - it's quiet and picturesque although the canal is a popular route for gondola tours. Our so called 'superior' room reeked of stale cigarette smoke which took two days to dissipate. Things got worse -unfortunately there had been a sudden drop in temperature just before we arrived. Although public areas were heated, the bedrooms were not, and that night we froze and as a result slept badly. When challenged the next day as to why the bedrooms were not heated, we were given a variety of explanations by members of staff. We had a sinking feeling that the truth was being avoided so it was a relief when by late evening of the second day the problem was resolved. There was no offer of a reduction on the bill for the considerable inconvenience, and the staff were neither gracious nor friendly. The problem with Venice is repeat business is not an issue - service is not a strong point and prices are outrageous. Despite all that, it is still a magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, so-so service.”
Reviews.Author: weberpoint
Reviews.Content: Beautiful small hotel located on the San Moise Canal, just a short walk from St. Mark's. Rooms and bathrooms are very nicely decorated (Murano glass chandeliers). Our room had full height windows and walk-out balcony right on the canal. Beware that this is both a pro and a con. Watching and listening to the gondolas pass by is very nice. But, at 5am the delivery and garbage boats show up and they can be noisy. On the negative side, the front desk staff is polite, but stiff, and not particularly helpful. The Breakfast is indifferent, and nothing to look forward to. Overall, however, I can't imagine a better location or room to stay in while in Venice. Note: we had room 109.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not what we booked!”
Reviews.Author: Jammy888
Reviews.Content: After a long walk with luggage down the alleys of Venice from St Mark's Square we arrived at this hotel only to be told that we were going to be staying at "their other building around the corner". A fifteen minute walk later - a hotel porter did carry our bags - we arrived at a 'sister' hotel Ca' Fortuny. The room was small - barely bigger than the bed - but had a lovely bathroom, with jacuzzi bath, and was very clean. Location was good, but then again everywhere is only really a short walk from anywhere else, and was very peaceful. I rated this a 3 as it was expensive for a small room and I like to stay where I have booked.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto San Moise!”
Reviews.Author: capriccio
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel San Moise perfect in every way. It was the best Italian hotel experience we have ever had. We booked two canal view rooms, one for our children (age 17 and 10) and one for ourselves. Our room could not have been more perfect - a spacioius suite with a magnificent Venetian glass light fitting and a large geranium-filled balcony right over the canal. We spent the first two hours sipping chilled Proseco on the balcony, taking in the beautiful scenes all around us - a continual procession of gondolas, some with singers and accordionists, steered by gondoliers who skillfully turned their boats around 180 degrees at the edge of the hotel building. What an introduction to this lovely city for our children. It was simply perfect. The location was very central. Service at reception was outstandingly good. Breakfast was fresh and satisfying. We have nothing but praise for this gem of a hotel. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fellman
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel (6th-10th August 2007) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had read quite a number of reviews, of our own experiences we found the positive reviews are fairly accurate. The only negative aspect was the street hawkers who hang about the alleyway, from late afternoon to early evening waiting to move into the main designer area to sell their fake designer bags. We found this unnerving for a couple of days, but to be fair we never had any approaches or hassle from these people. That was the negative, everything else about the Hotel San Moise is positive great location,close to St Marks Square, also a twenty minute walk to Rialto Bridge and about the same distance to Accademia art gallery. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel decor is elaborate and certainly pleasing to the eye. Our room (family room for four) could easily have put a smile on Queen Victoria's face, it certainly put one on ours. The hotel is clean and tidy, with the chambermaids and porters doing a very good job Some reviewers had difficulty locating the hotel,be advised to go to the hotels own website and copy their map. When you locate Calle Larga XX11 ( it's the street with all the designer boutiques ) walk down the alley opposite the Gucci shop and turn right at the end towards the canal, this is where the hotel reception is located. A decent breakfast is provided to give you a good start to the day. We definitely would stay at this hotel again. 'You only get what you pay for' the saying is certainly true for the Hotel San Moise. We travelled from Cumbria, England

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon23
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for 1 night only in July 2007. We took a very expensive cab to the hotel, then upon arrival at San Moises we were told that we were going to be booked at the newer 'Ca Anise. Room was very nice, spacious, good thing we were only on the second floor coz there was no elevator. Reception was able to change money for us at a very good rate, and was also able to book us a taxi back to the train station. We would definitely go back to 'Ca Anise/San Moise again, and will recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Wonder...”
Reviews.Author: SemiLOOSE
Reviews.Content: this was the first place we booked into of our mini italy tour so it was good to get a hotel that delivered. we were travelling on a budget and wanted somewhere central and san moise is perfect for that. the hotel was clean and tidy, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful and the reception is manned 24/7. the room and the bathroom were very clean. there is a canal leading up to the hotel and some gondolas go past it, so its nice to watch especially the ones with singing. cant really fault this hotel, booked triple room and was very impressed with the standards. breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Couple2007
Reviews.Content: Wow- from reading the reviews looks like everyone loved this place. I wonder if we got the cheapest room in the house. This was our most expensive hotel out of all of Italy so we had higher hopes. The location is wonderful- I agree with everyone on that. Our room was TINY- the smallest of any of our stays. We appreciated the air conditioning and the breakfast was very generous and probably one of the better of all of our hotels. We did have someone offer to carry our bags when we arrived- up all of the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel San Moise cheat”
Reviews.Author: ordinaryjoe
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend a trip to Venice but PLease be wary if you consider booking into the Hotel San Moise. The hotel on the website is very inviting but the reality is that, like me, you will probably book and pay to stay "Tucked away in a quiet corner of Venice, only a short distance from St Mark's Square" but will be housed in their "other building". This is a new building and although clean and tidy is not near the Square or indeed near any of the canals. The breakfast room falls a long way short of "adding extravagence" as it is modern, small and very warm. I have just returned from celebrating my 25th Wedding Anniversary in Venice and although the visit was wonderful I would strongly advise against placing your trust in the Hotel San Moise. We stayed for 3 days and found the ACTV pass and Musuem Pass to be excellent in terms of efficiency, saving queueing time, and economy. We had a wonderful day in Murano having traveled by Vaperretto and would highly recommend the restuarant on Capo S Stefano.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Italy2007Marietta_GA
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for 3 nights in July 2007. Upon booking rooms at the San Moise, we learned that we might be transferred to an "annex" of the San Moise but we checked Trip Advisor and learned from others that the annex rooms were very nice. At check-in, we were in fact sent to the annex, called the 'Ca Anise. We loved our rooms there, they were spotlessly clean and the bathroom was spacious and well-appointed with qualiy fixtures and plenty of towels. We had a small flat screen TV and a comfortable 3rd bed (a twin) in the room for our teenager to sleep on. The breakfast is great by Italy standards -- they actually had scrambled eggs and meats, along with yogurt, fruits, cereal, and juice options. The front desk staff was not overly friendly but they were always present and we had no complaints about the services. There is a small bar and the bartender was very attentive and eager to help us relax with some drinks and small snacks after a long day of walking. We would definitely go back to 'Ca Anise/San Moise again, and will recommend it to all of our friends. One caution is that there are no elevators so carrying luggage up the stairs could be a problem. We were not offered any help with our luggage but found that throughout Italy, we did not get offered help with things like this such as we get in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: needstraveladvice
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been happier with our beautiful room on a side canal in Venice. This was our first trip to Venice and the location was perfect. This lovely hotel is close to San Marco but is quiet. Our room was very large and beautifully appointed and the bathroom was fine (good water pressure). We had a small balcony that hung over the canal and we could watch the gondoliers go by. In the morning the boats were delivering beautiful vegetables and flowers to nearby hotels and restaurants. The desk staff was helpful with restaurant suggestions also. We will definitely check here first for reservations before our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melekece
Reviews.Content: We went San Moise for our honeymoon and it was wonderfull. Our canal view room was really lovely. Workers were helpful. And the best thing is location. We reccomend San Moise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Canal View, Close to St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: dlist25
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a canal view room without a reservation. The room was beautiful and very clean. the view was phenomenal and the hotel is very close to St. Marks Square. We really enjoyed our stay here. I will tell you it is a little difficult to get to if you do not know exactly where the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay....”
Reviews.Author: TexasBConTour
Reviews.Content: We felt like royalty. The staff was very helpful and amazing with their suggestions. One gentleman on the desk gave us a suggestion of the best restaurant we ate at in our two week in Italy. It was quaint to be told that we would be leaving the building to go around the corner to get to our room. Through a pretty courtyard and up a flight of stairs and we were at our room. We overlooked the courtyard with welcoming sounds every morning then headed downstairs for a lovely breakfast with good selections. Location was wonderful - just a short walk to Saint Mark's Square where we found ourselves out late at night listening to the music. We felt very safe walking back to our hotel. All in all - big room or small - we'd recommend this hotel for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff and magic location”
Reviews.Author: geographylover
Reviews.Content: I spent a fantastic two nights at Hotel San moise with a large group. We were welcomed warmly by the staff and part of our party stayed in each of the two parts of the hotel. The location (right behind the posh shops and close to Teatro La Fenice) was perfect. The rooms were spacious, atmospheric and very comfortable and we were only sorry that we couldn't have been here to enjoy the courtyard in the summer! Will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: DaveManchester
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in Venice (midnight) is never the best start due to the labyrinth of alleyways and getting lost, but trust me, after a day you will find your bearings. The hotel (we stayed in the second one, a couple of minutes from the main hotel) is small, but clean and the bathroom / shower is very good. The location is excellent - near Rio Alto, St Mark Square and the Academia - in fact it is near to everything. The staff are very helpful and accommodating. Although this hotel could be on the slightly pricey side for a 3 star, this is Venice and in terms of location I believe it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb San Moise”
Reviews.Author: ThereseSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Hotel San Moise in Venice was superb. The hotel is very central, in a quiet location just off the posh shopping area. Room 106 was fab. Plush, clean, warm, historic - and with the most fantastic big bed. It overlooks the canal so very romantic too. Very close proximity to San Marco and the vaparetto stops so easy to get to and from the airport by water bus. Staff were unobtrusive, courteous, charming and very helpful. Small things like checking out a little later weren't a problem, nor were keeping our bags until late afternoon to allow for a baggage free day walking the island, were very useful.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant stay ruined our holiday”
Reviews.Author: bluenoteDublin
Reviews.Content: Our party of four mature adults, including two OAPS booked this hotel last November,following the reviews on this site. We requested TWO SUPERIOR TWIN ROOMS WITH CANAL VIEWS.There were confusing errors in their emails, quoting different prices etc. and then they confirmed TWO DOUBLE rooms. I emailed again asking for two rooms with TWO beds in EACH room.We eventually got our correct confirmation and arrived on the 5th of February 2007.
