Upon registering we were taken out into the street, round the corner and shown into another building and there we were shown Two Double rooms!!! The Receptionist bluntly said there was nothing he could do as he was on his own. He pointed out a couch against one wall and suggested this as a single bed. He then said he wouldn't charge us for a Triple room.! ! The following morning they changed the double beds to single beds. My sister complained about the noise each night in her room, but not until the 3rd morning would the Receptionist on duty go to her room and explain that it was the "heating pipes" and moved them to an attic room without view and a DOUBLE BED!! Guests sleeping preferences are clearly not important. Being in a different building meant that one us had to keep walking back to the Reception desk in the Hotel to leave in or collect the keys (as they demanded we do )whilst the others waited in the rain. Throughout all this we had asked on many occasions to see the Manager who was never available. Eventually we were told he would be there on Thursday morning, we waited after breakfast to be then told he would be there at 11, went back again at noon, to be told he was not due. We were told he had 4 hotels and was too busy to come. The reception staff eventually got him on the phone and following a conversation with his receptionist the phone was handed to me...he introduced himself as the owner and said "what do you want?" I said I was sure his staff had filled him in and asked what he proposed to do regarding the poor service we had experienced. I explained we were unhappy as we had reservations for TWIN rooms but had been given Doubles, and then there was noise issue which had made sleep impossible, At this he began to shout that he had 8 hotels and was far too busy for all this. He was actually yelling at me. My sister, who was standing quite some distance away, could hear him clearly shouting and yelling. I asked him to please stop shouting at me or I would have to cease the conversation. With very bad grace he offered 15euro off per room , I felt this was not a fair offer due to the distress he had caused all four of us. I mentioned we had booked his hotel because of Tripadvisor. At this he yelled "if you write anything about me I will get the most expensive lawyers in Italy after you." As I could not get a word in I gave the phone back to the Receptionist and said we would be back at 5pm as they had booked our Water Taxi for 6pm and our luggage had been moved to the Reception area. When we returned we asked for our account, we took out our credit cards etc. and then noticed they had deducted the 15euro offered per room. We did not wish to accept this sum as we fully intended complaining to the tourist board. Two sleepless nights, and two nights forced to share a bed we felt deserved more recognition. The Receptionist grinned and said "your bill has been paid." They had actually "drawn down " the total from the credit card details I gave as Security to reserve the rooms in December. I was very upset as I had not authorised this and in fact we had intended splitting the bill as I am sure is usual for 4 people holidaying together. We then put the 75euro , they had deducted , on the counter , the receptionist refused to accept the cash. He said he was Not Allowed Accept it. We said fine and left it there. As we waited for the taxi ,a man arrived, spoke to the Receptionist, picked up the money and said "I dont want this" opened the door of the hotel and THREW the money into the street!!!!!! This turned out to be the OWNER ! I am in the hospitality industry and have never experienced guests being treated like this and sincerly hope I never do again. This whole experience spoilt what should have been a quiet and peaceful break.

Reviews.Title: “short break in Venice”
Reviews.Author: murelly
Reviews.Content: Venice : The Hotel Sam Moise" Date: January 2007 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Dublin Ireland. I have just returned from a stay in Venice. Booked the Hotel before I knew about this website. in common with quite a lot of the reviews we were also redirected to another Hotel, in this case the Hotel Fortuny. It was further from St. Marks Square, however our room though quite small was very clean. The bathroom was also clean. The jacuzzi bath puzzles me as there is insufficient hot water to fill it more than 3 inches. This is the only complaint I have - insufficient hot water. Most mornings the water got quite cold for the 2nd shower. I also tried the water at different times during the day and the situation was the same. On another note we went to a fantastic restuarant called La Trovasa, excellent food and extremely reasonable prices. it opens at 7pm, however the queue begins to form at 6.40pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilLondon
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean hotel. High standard of room. Great buffet breakfast. Although we went to san Moise then stayed at Ca Fortuny (which they own) it was only a few minutes away and this was not a problem. Helpful and friendly staff and great location. Although very close to Rialto Bridge it was in a quiet picturesque street. H English London

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: HLR
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard double room at this hotel after reading good reviews on tripadvisor. First the good news - the location was indeed great and the hotel was easy to find and near a water boat stop; the staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English and the breakfast was above average. It's served from 7-10am and there was a decent variety of food to choose from. Now the not so good news - our room was extremely small (although clean and nicely decorated); however our main bug bear was the noise. We could hear literally every word and footstep in the surrounding rooms partly due to the rooms having marble floors. We were in room 104 so if you value your space or are a light sleeper then I wouldn't recommend you book this room. We saw some of the superior rooms and they were infinitely nicer and more than double the size. We might go back to this hotel but only if we could afford to stay in one of the larger rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: countrylamberts
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were well taken care of by the staff. We arrived early and were allowed to leave our bags while we toured Venice. Our room was spectacular. We booked the triple with canal view and a double with canal view. Our teenage girls said they felt like "princesses" in their room. Very ornate and lovely. It was the most charming canal view that I could imagine. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy. The staff spoke English and made every effort to make our stay comfortable. We asked for extra towels-due to a spill- and they were sent up immediatley. We stayed during Dec. and the heated towel bars were a welcomed treat. We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “All the Romance of Venice”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadFromCalif
Reviews.Content: We read about this hotel on TripAdvisor and decided to try it out. We booked the Double Room with Canal View/ It was expensive but really worth it. Just as romantic as your other reviewer said. As we checked into the room and opened the window, the gondolas began floating through our small canal accompanied by sonorous singing (not many of todays gondoliers sing). We really felt as if we had stepped back in time and were catching a glimpse of Venice during it's romantic heyday. (With the added bonus of modern plumbing & facilities!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite for a family”
Reviews.Author: Who_Dun_Dare
Reviews.Content: Although not in the main hotel, the air conditioned, family suite (room 301) comprising lounge area, two bedrooms, an excellent bathroom with shower and jaccussi was just right for our two teenage daughters and us. The terrace was an added bonus for breakfast and a quite drink. The second building is still very central but quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb treatment at San Moise”
Reviews.Author: angelwil
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived in Venice burdoned with heavy bags after a beautiful but tiring couple of weeks exploring Italy. We were very grateful for the porter who carried our bags to San Moise's second building (very well situated). The moment we arrived at San Moise, we were treated like royalty (despite looking like stray animals). Sergio at the front desk welcomed us with a smile and was consistently helpful throughout our stay. Once, he spotted us trying to negotiate a map ON HIS DAY OFF and WALKED US to the place we were looking for! The restaurant he recommended was top class. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. We grew quite fond of the built in jacuzzi in the bath! We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful during our stay and would like to thank them for making our time in Venice so enjoyable. Angela Williams

Reviews.Title: “Top of the class for Value & Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: 123a
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and myself arrived late at night at the main reception area and were taken to our room which was in a completely different building - approx. 10 minutes walk away. Very friendly porters carried our bags. The walk made us wary but we needn't have been - the building was newly renovated, and our room consisted of a 1-bed apartment with a private roof terrace and lcd tv - we booked the standard room and were not charged any extra. Modern and spotless. Staff were all extremely helpful, even securing us a last minute booking for dinner in a very popular restaurant on a Saturday night. Location is excellent - bang in the middle or within walking distance of all major attractions. All in all - not 5 star but doesn't profess to be - cannot be faulted for value for money. Fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: tradescantia
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 in two separate rooms) spent two nights at Hotel San Moise and it was just OK. The location is good, but we had been to Venice before and my husband said he would have been happier if we had stayed somewhere else. We had two 'superior' rooms; one was on the canal and one was not. Our canal view room was very dark, partly due to decorating (dark red walls) and also because it faced a very narrow part of the canal. There was a Murano glass chandelier and interesting decorative touches, but it was dark and a bit gloomy. We were able to glimpse into another canal view room on the same floor and it was larger, bright and airy. The lobby of the hotel is very small so there is limited ability to sit and wait for others, or to wait for your room to be ready. The staff was OK but not especially helpful or friendly compared to our hotels/inns in Tuscany and Rome. It was very difficult to get anyone to answer when we called the front desk, I think because staffing was limited. We paid for internet access but were very limited re: where we could get a signal, and there was no one to reset the server when needed. Breakfast was fine. The hotel was OK but we would not stay there again -

Reviews.Title: “Lemonade out of lemons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I feel I must relate our experience with the Hotel San Moise in Venice .. My wife and I had made reservations for a three night stay at the Hotel San Moise through venere for our trip at the end of May, confirming the reservation directly with the hotel via email two weeks before our scheduled departure. Imagine my shock when I received an email the day before our departure from venere confirming our cancellation of the San Moise reservation! Of course, no other rooms were to be found in Venice on such short notice. After several days and numerous emails back and forth, the San Moise found space for us for our three nights in Venice. As we had already made alternate lodging arrangements, we declined their offer. We were pleasantly surprised when the San Moise offered us two nights free lodging later this year. As our daughter and her cousin were going to be in Venice two weeks later, we were able to take them up on their offer. The girls just returned from their trip with nothing but raves for the San Moise, its location and the services they provided. My daughter said that the staff paid special attention to them, making sure all of their needs were met. The Hotel San Moise took a disastrous situation and turned it into a good experience for all. Thanks to them for taking the extra steps necessary to resolve the issues. My wife and I look forward to staying at the San Moise the next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, deserves 4+ stars, but misleading advertising”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelLuvNewYork
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. But there was one disappointing detail that I wish I knew in advance. Misleading advertising. When we got to this hotel, it was in the most beautiful location, right on the gondola-filled canal. Very close to San Marco's Square and all the cool shopping streets. We were ecstatic. It was just as I'd pictured it. ................... And then we were told that they don't have any rooms in the main building, only in the building "next door." Just like many other guests before us, we were misled. A 5 minute walk later, we were at a totally different hotel, on a totally different street, in a different part of town than was originally planned for, and most importantly, NOT ON THE CANAL. We were really disappointed. Their advertisement talks about the "gondola-filled canal" that we'd dreamed about. The incredibly sweet and courteous manager tried to convince us that this hotel was even better than the one we booked, and repeated the same practiced sentence that I'd read in other reviews "It's a better location because it's equidistant to the Rialto Bridge, the Academia, and San Marco's Square. Plus, the rooms are "deluxe". Not totally satisfied with this answer, we decided to give this a try. The name of this hotel is Ca' Fortuny. Here are the things we loved: -Quiet street, no noise, peaceful -Fantastic room, big room, clean, new, bathroom has a jacuzzi, big bed -Warm (you can control temperature in the room) -Working TV with good channels -Service is fantastic -Everyone is super super nice (this is their biggest plus)--the staff is so attentive, helped us with all our questions -didn't charge us for using the phone for local calls -Breakfast is good with scrambled eggs -central location that is a good walking distance to everything I cannot say anything negative about Ca' Fortuny. I am completely satisfied with it. The only thing is that I wish they'd informed us that the location may be different. In short, this hotel was perfect (considering the price--I think about 110 Euro per night) even though it wasn't what we originally booked. I would definitely come back here again, but I hope they change their misleading advertising. I would stay on the canal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful Staff. Not Dimmed by Small Room.”
Reviews.Author: rcb
Reviews.Content: I was recently reminded of our 1-night stay last year, and want to add my name to the chorus of those endorsing this hotel. Its close to the little Bascillica S. Moise where there's a small square and a little canal-bridge that attracts gondollas. Its in a fashion-store area, which could be dangerous if your spouse is into high fashion. I liked the location becuz, once over the lttle (4 or 5 step) bridge, it was almost a straight shot to the grand canal and the vaparetto stops, or just a short walk to St. Marks -- and can easily find it after getting lost wandering the back-streets. Its actually behind the stores, tucked away down a short alley and around a corner. It has its own courtyard and a its breakfast room is a basement-level enclosed boathouse. I found the staff to be quite pleasant, professional and helpful. The room was tiny, but had adequate amenities. It may be pricy for some, but IMHO, for a short stay its definitely worth it. One reviewer last year had a rate issue due to a reservation change. I've found that most often, these problems are due to not thinking ahead and confirming changes. I saw a traveller arrive in Rome to find her hotel reservation cancelled becuz the CC she used to confirm was cancelled... by her. Doh! Changes or special requests need to be done thru the hotel directly, in advance, and written confirmation of oral commitments is needed. Documented confirmations are commonly honored, even if the clerk is a dim-wit.

Reviews.Title: “I don't get it??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 13 day vacation all across Italy. Before I begin this review, I would like to say that we are a well travelled couple and have done extensive travelling and have stayed in many, many hotels, motels, 2, 3,-6 stars and still cannot understand how everyone has rated this hotel thus far a 4 star plus? Are we rating the same hotel??? Before I made my decision about this hotel, I kept an open mind and was not expecting lavish or nearly anything spectacular as I have been told by other people that the hotels in Italy are rather small. I choose this hotel based on the reviews and it sounded to be the best for the price in comparison to some other ones. Upon our arrival, the room that was assigned to us had the worst smell ever (kind of like someone had urinate in it). I immediately went to ask to be moved to another room. Luckily, there was an extra room of the same size. The size of these two rooms had to be approximately 10 x 6. Now with that said, can you imagine what the bathroom looked like? It was literally like a closet and there was no room for both of us and our suitcases. There was no way that two people could fit in there at the same time. Then when my husband tried to turn of the TV for a quick relaxation before we began our journey in Venice, the TV it did not work. He tried calling the front desk for assistance but the gentlemen did not answer his call. After the third try, my husband walk down to the front desk to confront him and the gentlemen apologized for not picking up our call. This led my husband to believe he was avoiding us as he was already unhappy that we had complained about the room that smelled like urine. We had hoped to at least be able to use an iron at their hotel but we were told that they did not have one. They offered to pressed my skirt at a cost of 4.50 euro. I now know why they do not have irons in their rooms. Needless to say, my husand and I had to walk around in wrinkled clothes for dinner that evening. To top this review off, I would like to comment about their daily breakfast. The only word to describe this breakfast is "disgusting". I'm the furthest from being a picky eater ( I can even eat plain toast) as long as what I'm eating looks like what its supposed to be. Now, this buffet breakfast did offer a variety of things, one of which is scrambled eggs which I love having for breakfast in the morning. Unfortunately, this was not the case, the eggs were green It just did not look appetizing, especially first thing in the morning. One morning, my husband who is a bacon fanatic asked the waiter if he was going to bring out anymore as there was no bacon in the pan. We sat there waiting for 20 mins and still they did not replenish so we just ended up leaving. They also do not throw out over brewed old coffee, they just serve it rather than brewing a fresh pot. Unfortunately, our stay was not pleasant and we cannot for the life of us understand how it would be possible for other reviewers to have experienced this hotel to be at the high standards mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Book your stay at the San Moise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice and had a brilliant time. The annexe to the Hotel San Moise - Ca Fortuny is excellent. All the staff are incredibly attentive, polite and very friendly. Our daughter had a tummy upset on our last day and Sergio went out of his way to make up a tray of tea, toast, jam and yogurt for her! Excellent pharmacy close by too! Breakfast is very good - egg, bacon, frankfurters, toast, croissants, yogurts, fruit, meats, cheese, jams, cereals, coffee, tea and chocolate. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean, and whilst you are out exploring the wonders of Venice you return to a cleaned room with fresh, warm towels. The staff organised a free water taxi to Murano for us - beware of strong selling tactics there, but do walk round Murano island - it is wonderful. Remember you have to walk off all the amazing Italian food (funnily we found the best restaurant at the bottom of the street!) we thought the location was perfect - in a typical Venecian street, but quiet. Definitely recommend this Hotel! Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zing61
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation to Italy where we spent just two nights in Venice. The Hotel San Moise was in a great location. When we arrived by train from Florence, we took a water taxi which dropped us off right out front of the hotel. It was a lot more expensive than the water bus, but with two families (7 of us) and all of our luggage, we thought it would be easier to take the taxi - and we were right! Our room was big and comfortable for the four of us and it was very clean! We had a small balcony with a wonderful view of the canal and a small bridge. All in all, we didn't spend much time in our room but we were very happy with the Hotel San Moise. We would recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GillyArt
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here in January this year when it was very very cold outside, but sunny and Venice is wonderful at whatever time of year! The hotel was a revelation! We were a party of 4, myself and hubby and brother in law and nephew. We all had beautiful rooms and ours was so large I thought it was a small ballroom! The chandelier itself was a sight to behold! The ensuites were large and clean and the lighting great, the beds very comfortable, the service and the ambience brilliant, and the breakfast more than adequate. The staff were friendly and the situation was very central. All you have to do to get there fast is to download their map form the hotel's website. We caught the water bus from the bus station, and walked for 5 minutes only. No problems, and the hotel was lovely and warm and had marvellous hot water. We are planning another stay here soon. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This year my wife and me had stayed the second time in Hotel San Moise. Two years ago we stayed in Hotel San Moise and loved the nice rooms with the wooden ceiling. The breakfast was served in a friendly room and one could order extra coffee (cappucino, cafe latte,..). We were really exalted about this very nice hotel nearest St. MarkÂ´s Square. Some weeks later we sent our parents to this hotel and they were very satisfied too. This year IÂ´ve organised a journey to the carneval for 14(!) persons and 10 of them had standard rooms reserved in Hotel San Moise, 4 were booked for Ca fortuny (in superior rooms) (the second building of the hotel). First to say: the emailing with the hotel was always fast, friendly and correct. We were informed, that Ca fortuny would be 200 meters away from San Moise. The day before our arrival one couple had to cancel, because of illness. I informed the hotel by telephone about this cancellation. When we arrived we were told, that all of us would live in Ca fortuny. At the first moment I was irritated, but soon I realised that it would be very nice, when all of us would be in the same building. Ca fortuny is about 3-5 minutes to walk from San Moise near the lovely Campo S. Stefano. AND we were upgraded for free: the superiors to luxury and two of the standards to superior! On friday evening we had our masquerade ball and got a make up for free! Although IÂ´ve phoned only (I had no more possibility for sending a fax or email) the couple which canceled, had just to pay one night cancellation fee and got the rest of the money back. Some critics: the breakfast room in Ca fortuny is too small for all guests (which never had been a problem for us). The two standard rooms were one to enter from the breakfast room and the other from the lobby. Although both are quiet! A really fantastic hotel with a nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a split personality”
Reviews.Author: Mark&NicUK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after much research on this and other web sites. We wanted central with breakfast at a good price. (Well good price for Venice, everything is pretty expensive). The San Moise is difficult to find, it took us an hour from the water bus stop outside Harrys bar. Look out for the old gas lamp high up on a wall pointing down a narrow ally to the hotel. When we arrived, we were first excited by the decor in the reception (all glass and antique mirrors) and then horrified when we were told that we were in the "new annex". After a 5 minute walk over bridges, down allys and accross squares, we arrived at the annex. By this time I was a little upset as I thought that I was being ripped off. I should not have worried at all, the annex was brand new and immaculatly decorated with marble and fine furniture. The room was fantastic and judging by the small amounts of building dust and some odds and ends of builders waste (wood shavings and electrical insulation) we were the first guests to stay in the room. An assumption that was confirmed by the door man later in our stay. The very small amounts of mess vanished by day two and we went on to thouroughly enjoy our stay. The room had great lighting, a major problem in a lot of hotels. Hom many times have you got into bed only to find out that you can't turn the bloody lights off!! The air con was fully electronic and worked very well. Breakfast was excellent and vast self service, typical Italian with very very strong coffee. The annex has no facilities, such as bars and resturants etc, but you are in Venice!!! Go and explore. Excellent hotel, right in the middle of everything, would stay again. The annex is so good, that we never went back to the main hotel, not even to find out what we might have missed out on! Mark & Nic Nottingham England.

Reviews.Title: “St Moise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AhVienna
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 2 nights b&b at hotel San Moise. Lovely hotel, central, all sights in walking distance. Very reasonable price. Can recommend 2 restaurants for lunch - San Trovaso in Dorsoduro & La Zucca in San Polo / Santa Croce.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and excellent accomodation and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Moise is in the heart of Venice and truly one of the most Romantic hotels and settings I have had the privlege to stay in. The location is ideal for San Marco Square, restaurants, shops, and anything else you would like to see or do as a visitor to this amazing city. Furthermore, on request you can get rooms with views overlooking one of the many canals with an amazing balcony. However, what really makes this hotel special is the personal and unique service offered by the hotel staff. I chose this hotel as a place to propose to my now fiancee and shared this with the staff prior to my stay. As a result I was given one individual, Riccardo, to deal with throughout my holiday. Riccardo put enormous amounts of effort in helping my make this trip truly special and easily accomodated any individual requests whilst recommending various more. Furthermore, a gift of a box of chocolates as you leave made you feel like this truly was a special hotel which values its guests. For this very point alone I would strongly recommend this hotel. Thank you to all the staff at the San moise for making us feel so welcome and making this an unforgettable weekend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel San Moise in early Feb 2006 for a wonderful 3 nights. It was our first visit to Venice and we fell in love with the city..and Hotel San Moise. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful and we couldn't get over how beautiful our room was. We woke each morning to a fantastic view over the canal with gondolas floating passed our balcony. Hotel San Moise truly was exceptional for the room, the view, the service and location (We were just a couple of minutes stroll from St Mark's square). Our stay in this hotel made our visit to Venice truly magical!! Thank you to all the staff for a lovely stay we only wish we had been there longer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kezich
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 kids to Venice for Christmas, and we stayed at the San Moise Hotel. I am so glad we did. The hotel was beautiful, quiet, located just off San Marco Square, yet away from the hustle bustle. The staff, especially Artemio was wonderful. He took such good care of us, was so helpful. We truly enjoyed our stay at the San Moise, and I hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent San Moise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As we arrived at the San Moise Hotel it was as though we were being welcomed by old friends into their magnificent Venetian home. The doors to our spacious, chandelier adorned room were opened and as we pulled back the gold and brocade drapes it was revealed - the canal with gondolas floating past our windows. Each afternoon we would sit in our windows, sipping champagne and waving at the passing parade. The San Moise Hotel is situated just a very short stroll from San Marco Square and a one minute walk from the Vaporetto stop. Staying at the San Moise will make your stay in Venice a truly memorable one! Lesley Power

Reviews.Title: “Serene San Moise”
Reviews.Author: etpfleger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Moise for three days in September with another couple. We booked the most expensive rooms, but they were well worth it (plus they were cheaper than waterview rooms on the grand canal). Both rooms had a balcony and views of the canal. The singing gondaliers would float by every evening. It was very much like staying in your own palazzo. Our room had floor to ceiling windows in front of the balcony. It was absolutely amazing! The breakfast was fine and the location was great. Very close to St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel even if not the one we booked!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Venice I was truly amazed with the beauty of the city but as it was late approx 10pm we decided to set about trying to find the hotel. On finding the street where we knew the hotel to be around we were unable to find the hotel itself. It is only sign posted by a very small light with hotel San Moise written on it and not very noticeable. We went straight on to the hotel to be told they had our reservation (which had been confirmed both by email and phone) but that we would be staying in the Hotel Ca' Fortuny their "sister" hotel but because we had been moved that we would be upgraded to a suite. A bit of inconvenience but the thoughts of a lovely suite eased the inconvenience some what. We walked for approx 10minutes with the concierge of the hotel san moise to be met by the concierge of the Hotel Ca' Fortuny. Check in was no problem and we proceeded to our room. The suite was truly beautiful with a small sitting area with flat screen television and a double bed. The second room had two single beds, cooking area with sink (not plumped), and a door that led onto our balcony. The bathroom was spacious with separate shower and Jacuzzi bath. The room had all the usual amenities bar, phone, sat television etc. The breakfast the next morning was very tasty. On offer was cereals, fresh fruit, salami, cheese, ham, eggs, sausages, bacon, toast, croissants, bread rolls and tea and coffee enough to fill the heartiest of stomachs. The staff were extremely friendly and always greeted us with an hello an entering leaving the hotel and also was very helpful in recommending a good nightlife spot - "The Devils forest pub". All in all I would recommend the hotel Ca' Fortuny but would have preferred to have been told when I rang that we had been moved from the Hotel San Moise. I do look forward to going back again to enjoy either hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Sasn Moise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the San Moise Hotel in Venice for 3 nights as part of our 25th wedding anniversary celebrations. We would like to congratulate the Hotel on the standard and comfort of our room and facilities the beautiful courtyard view we had the wonderful breakfast that we enjoyed every day But most of all the helpful, well informed and friendly staff who made our stay the more memorable on an occasion will always be special to us. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Moise - a superb hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review is to give our highest recommendation to the Hotel San Moise in Venice. Our recommendation is twofold: First of all, my husband and I stayed in the Hotel San Moise in 2003. The hotel is wonderful - a 17th century home, very well located with a most pleasant and helpful staff. Our large room faced a small canal and was complete with tall French doors opening onto our small private balcony. Our lovely accomodations made our stay in Venice a most memorable one. Secondly, we were so pleased with Hotel San Moise, we booked the same room for our daughter and granddaughter in October 2005. After staying six days in Rome, they had planned to take a train to Venice when they were notified of the tragic auto accident which resulted in the death of my daughter's husband. They of course flew home from Rome immediately and it was necessary for me to cancel their two night reservation on the very day they were due to arrive at the Hotel San Moise. Because of such short notice I fully expected to pay the full amount. Instead the management E-mailed me extending their condolences and advising me of their decision not to charge anything, neither the first nor the second night of this reservation. I feel this was more than generous and they should be highly commended for their compassionate customer satisfaction policy. I would certainly urge anyone traveling to Venice to book a room at the Hotel San Moise - it is truly a very special hotel in every way. Joan Bray San Carlos, California U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markjoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's. There were some hot items (like eggs and bacon) as well as homemade croissants and rolls for breakfast (as well as the usual yogurt, cereal, cold ham and cheese) and the room was of moderate size with lovely Murano glass lights. Overall we were happy with this property, except the beds, which were not too comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Moise - a very good place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: yankel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Moise for 3 nights in October, 2005. The hotel was wonderful. We arrived by water taxi and were dropped off right at the front door. even though we arrived late at night there was someone there to meet us and show us to our rooom. the room, suite 101, on the second floor, overlooking a courtyard was huge and beautiful. the bathroom was large. Most important, everyone at the front desk was helpful, considerate and spoke english well enough for us to communicate. The location was about 3 blocks from San Marco - an easy walk, but far enough away to be quiet at night. they have a very nice breakfast, and if you sit in the right spot you have a view of a canal.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 11 days in Italy - and 3 at the Hotel San Moise in Venice. We felt fortunate to stay at the San Moise for several reasons. We researched hotels in Venice carefully because we were traveling with our 3-year old daughter and 4-month old son. With all our luggage, we wanted a hotel that was right on a canal and accessible by water-taxi - so we wouldn't have to lug our suitcases and two children around Venice to get to the hotel. Being on a canal generally means the most expensive hotels (a la Hotel Gritti, Danielli, Bauer Palace). After reading many reviews and studying maps of hotel locations, we decided the Hotel San Moise was the only hotel both on the water and near Saint Mark's Square which didn't cost $400 Euros a night. And our guess proved right. The Hotel San Moise is right on the side canal directly to the west of Saint Mark's Square - about 3 blocks from Saint Mark's - in the San Moise distict (named after the Cathedral San Moise about a block away). It is also one block off the main street "Larga 22 Marzo", which is sort of the Rodeo Drive of Venice - with stores of all the major Italian designers (Fendi, Prada, Gucci, Cavali, etc.). The San Moise neighborhood couldn't be better and, as expected, there is a boat launch directly in front of the hotel - so that bell boys literally took our bags off the water-taxi and carried them up to our room. Heaven. Unlike other hotels within the San Moise district (like the Kette and Saturnia), many of the San Moise rooms look directly over the canal and you are serenaded by gondoliers going by on the canal all day long. It pegs the meter for Venice ambiance and romance. Our canal view room had a large picture window and balcony overlooking the canal - and it was sumptuously decorated in Venetian furniture and fabrics. It was a large "family room" and accomodated us and our two children easily. Breakfast was good and the staff were very courteous. Note: I took a previous review here as a cautionary tale and did not book through Bookings or any other internet site. Since I was up at 1:00 a.m. anyway researching hotels, I decided to just call the San Moise directly (at 10:00 am Venice time). I got through immediately, was greeted by an english-speaking concierge, and was quoted a rate 30% less than Bookings for our room!! I faxed them our information that day and they faxed back a reservation confirmation within hours! It all went fantastically! I called again before we left, just to confirm our reservation, and they were right on the ball with it. So, I would generally recommend phoning directly, regardless of which hotel you decide on. That way you get the personal touch and you set them up to succeed, not fail.

Reviews.Title: “Close to St. Mark's”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel the night before our cruise (Oct. 9th). Choose it due to proximity to the Allilaguna (sp) boat that runs to the cruise dock. You could take the regular valporetta (sp), but luggage can be a hassle and you have to get off at the Plaza Roma and take the shuttle bus. The hotel is a couple of minutes from St. Marks and very convenient to the Allilaguna boat from the airport. Staff was very nice and accommadating. The room was fairly large, but appeared dated and the ceiling had several large stains. Bathroom was clean, but very small. Breakfast was OK and breakfast room was fine. There is a small sign off of the main street so it is easy to find even though it is down a small alley. I think that there are better values in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on canal near St. Mark's Square.”
Reviews.Author: YorbaLinda15
Reviews.Content: Just a five minute walk to the square, the hotel was very clean and the staff treated us appropriately. Our room was small, as expected, but the bath was modern and clean. Breakfast was adequate. Good value for seeing Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Moise is a beautiful hotel. We paid to upgrade to a room with a view of the canal and the extra money was well worth it. We awoke each morning to the sound of the gondaliers serenading us. It was incredible. The hotel is in a great location, within 2 minutes of San Marco's square. The breakfasts were delicious. Our room was small but great for just the two of us. Also, take advantage of the free trek out to Murano. The private tour of the glass factory was great and the boat ride out was amazing. We did not have any problems with any of the people working at the desk. Everyone was polite, knowledgeable, and helpful. I highly recommend Hotel San Moise for your next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of booking here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel because it is an old converted Venician building right on a canal. When we arrived at this hotel we were told that our room would be ready in one hour. We smiled and said 'that's fine' and went for an hour and a quarter walk. When we came back we sat quietly in the corner of the reception room and waited because the concierge/desk clerk did not say anything to us. We waited for around twenty minutes at which point my wife enquired, in a very friendly manner, as to whether the room was ready. The attitude of the concierge/desk clerk (Julianne? my wife thinks this was the name he used on the telephone) changed abruptly, he became dismissive and told us that rooms became ready for occupation at one o'clock. Some time later the same concierge/desk clerk informed us that the porter would be coming to take our bags to our room which was in another building not physically attached to the San Moise Hotel. At this point I remembered reading a review posted on this site where another traveller warned of being involuntarily switched to another hotel. I queried the arrangement presented by stating that we did not wish to stay at any "sister hotel". Well folks this is where things started to go badly wrong! There was no one else in the reception area and the concierge/desk clerk became very hostile saying that the hotel we were going to be escorted to was not a â€œsister hotelâ€� but the same hotel. We pleaded that we had booked to stay in the hotel in which we were sitting but he became most aggressive and stared at us in an extremely antagonistic manner, repeating his claim that it was the same hotel. He said that we would be able to see all the same sights and that we were not entitled to object because it was the same hotel and the building was only a short distance away. This was our vacation, so realising that there seemed to be little to be gained from the exchange except further unpleasant opposition, we agreed to see the room in the other building. Even after we did this the man continued to stare aggressively and repeated his question about whether we wanted to see the room or not. I said â€˜okayâ€™ twice but he carried on with this performance! Anyway, a very pleasant porter arrived and took our heaviest case while I carried the two smaller ones. He led us some considerable distance right over to the other side of the San Marco district to a building without any hotel sign displayed outside. We entered through doors which had â€œCaâ€™ Fortunyâ€� inscribed on the glass, tipped the porter and explained to a female desk clerk that we had not booked for this hotel but for the San Moise. She told us that it was the same hotel. I walked to the door and pointed at the â€œCaâ€™ Fortunyâ€� printing. She then admitted that alright it was not part of the San Moise Hotel but had the same owners! It turned out that she had been there for only two months and had obviously been fed the preposterous lines to dictate to anyone who objected to the treatment. We ended up feeling sorry for her as she had been put in a most unfortunate situation by the management of the two hotels. To cut a long story short, we went to the room in this modern/totally refurbished building which was totally lacking in atmosphere. The room was well appointed, clean and we accepted it to avoid further trouble. At night the climate control system was noisy and kept us awake, the room was too warm but the junior staff were very pleasant, the room was cleaned very efficiently; the breakfast was more than adequate. We enjoyed our stay in Venice very much and buried the appalling treatment we received while we were there. We are reasonable and tolerant people but would not book at the Hotel San Moise again in case the owners acquire properties even further away! Travellers beware!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss This One!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two "3 star" hotels in Venice (based on rankings elsewhere) and there is no comparing the quality of Hotel San Moise to the other (Hotel Torino, which should be bypassed if possible). Every positive thing you read about Hotel San Moise is accurate, based on our experience: The staff was very attentive, knowledgeable, and helpful; they do speak English very well. Our room was beautiful, cozy, quiet, and clean, and being able to walk from it through lovely hallways and a secluded courtyard before entering the further magic and wonder of Venice made our days there some of the best of our lives so far.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for the bait and switch.”
Reviews.Author: all121star
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with a view of the canal. When we arrived at 3:00 pm on the date we were to check in, we were told that we had been moved to their new "sister" property just down the street. We were told that they had no rooms available in the San Moise, but that their sister hotel had a room for us. I told them that I wanted to see the "new" room and they guided us on a 7 minute walk "right down the street" to the other property. The other property was just as nice, 3-star, but the room they had available for us had no canal view and they would not give us a cheaper rate. After 30 minutes of haggling with the staffs of the two hotels, we got them to knock 10 Euros/night off of the room rate. It wasn't much, but at least it was something. The rooms was clean and nice and the staff was helpful and friendly. But it just puts a slight damper on your vacation, that we had planned for 2 years, when you don't get the room that you specifically reserved or even in the same hotel as you specifically reserved. They had my email address and phone number, so I would have appreciated a quick email or call letting me know that the room we had reserved would not be available after all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Classy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed only one night at this lovely hotel but wished it could have been longer. The location is great-on a quiet street but you can walk to all tourist attractions.We walked to St Marks from here.There are restaurants and shopping nearby and also a square with lots of other activities. The breakfast was great-the staff friendly and helpful. I will definitely try to stay here again on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LizzyW
Reviews.Content: What an excellently placed hotel. We were only in Venice for 2 days and found this hotel to be very well priced, clean and functional and the staff were very courteous and helpful. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Precious gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Moise was an incredible find for my 2nd visit to Venice. My friend and I were warmly welcomed into this quaint but definitely-refined hotel, overlooking the canals. Its location is tucked away into a quiet corner, but close enough to the action of Piazza San Marco, etc. as to never feel disconnected. Our room was modern and well-appointed, complete with a beautiful Murano chandelier, and long, dormered windows opening to the canal. Breakfast is complimentary and quite adequate, and the front desk was more-than-happy to accomodate our questions regarding sites and restaurants. I was thrilled to find this gem of a hotel, and will send my aging parents there for their first european visit.

Reviews.Title: “calm and restrained”
Reviews.Author: GaryThomas
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel, in a good position, and quiet. Our canal view wasn't quite the one in the picture - we overlooked a landing stage where they off loaded goods in the morning, but we liked that. And it's on a gondola route too - but it was fun to watch them go by. We booked through the hotel's website. I think the review below concerning quoted rates from an agency may be unfair on the hotel - the agency site quotes rates which seem too low to be true.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic San Moise”
Reviews.Author: itsfriday
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 3 days of our honeymoon in the San Moise. We were welcomed by Luca the manager who was very friendly and helpful. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to an amazing room with a balcony looking right over a little canal. Watching the boats go by and listenning to the singing of the gondoliers was brilliant. The hotel is well furnished and maintained. The staff were multilingual and very approachable. San Moise is just off one of the smartest shopping streets in Venice and is just a short stroll away from St Marks, the Grand Canal and all the main attractions. Its the perfect location for short breaks and honeymoons!

Reviews.Title: “Never go there!”
Reviews.Author: mare985
Reviews.Content: If you ever had the "pleasure" to meet the director of this hotel, you know why no one should ever stay there. I booked the hotel through "bookings dot net" (never book with them EVER!), and there was a dispute in the amount I was to pay because neither the hotel staff nor "bookings dot net" made it a point to notify me of the hotel rate when I added an extra day. I got an oral confirmation through "bookings" that the hotel rate would be the same for all three nights (200 euro per night), for I was traveling around Europe and had no form of communication with me. When I checked out of the hotel, the hotel staff member (who was really nice - the only nice thing about the hotel, really) said that it was 460 euro (I know! Outrageous!) for the extra night. And then he had me speak on the phone with the director, named Gianluca Serra, who then proceeded to tell me that it was HIS hotel and he can do whatever he wanted and that he would charge my credit card that amount if I did not agree to that amount. Then, he cussed me out. Yes, ladies and gentlemen, who in their right mind as a customer service staff would cuss out a paying customer? I was being civil; I just had a problem with the amount so I was little ticked. The staff member then called "bookings dot net" and told me that they would handle it while I go sightseeing. When I returned, Gianluca was there and he told me that it was settled, and that I would be charged that day and that "bookings dot net" would refund me the extra 260 euro. Well, now that I'm back in the States, both "bookings dot net" and Gianluca take no fault and I am out that 260 euro. It's a terrible hotel with an even more terrible director. Please choose another hotel chain. Also, we were sent to another hotel on the first night because there was some leakage. So, we had to pay extra and were stuck in a worse part of Venice. Don't go there! Email me if you want the supporting documents from Gianluca Serra that show he promised I would get a refund for the first night.

Reviews.Title: “A real Venetian Beauty!!”
Reviews.Author: Zella
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I had high expectations of this hotel after reading the fabulous reviews and i was not disappointed!! It is in the best location in Venice( for the price) 2 mins walk to all the main attractions. ( right by the GUCCI shop) It is beautiful, characterful hotel, and yes it does smell quite delicious!!( like caramel). We booked through last minute and got a FANTASTIC deal..so were expecting to be put in the cellar!! apparently not..we had a yummy room ( very dark...due to beamed ceilings)complete with Murano class chandaliers.. a lovely writing desk, and a super clean and spacious bathroon and a really cheap minibar!!. The hotel has a private coutyard where u can sit annd drink ur minibar wine in the sun...bliss. We had a perfect time here and i would reccomend it to anyone looking to taste the real Venice( u really feel like u r living in a pallzzo) Hot Tips: book a canal view room..they look even better!! get a private motorlaunch from the Airport..we did and felt like stars>>also drops u right at the front door!( about80euro)DO NOT PAY more...they will try to rip u off at every opportunity...hold firm DO Go and visit the Academia area of venice...and the Frari church..stunning DO NOT pay more than 70 euro for a gondola ride..we were ripped off!( but too sozzled to care!! DO take loads of cash..this is not the place to worry about cash...go with the flo..we all know its billions of Â£ to get a drink, but somehow getting ripped off is all part of the experience!! ....they say everyone should go to Venice once in their lives...thats because u can ONLY afford to go once!!! DO NOT just stay around St MArks....Rialto area is great...lovely food markets DO go the hotel Danieli for lunch on the rooftop terrace...Amazing....not cheap.( u see now where the financial side of the holiday went out the window!!!!) Go to the hotel Monaco and grand canal for waterside views and great staff. Have a late night drink on the hotel Bauer terrace...very stylish and right near the hotel..when i am richer i will go and stay here....SUPERB GO in the Doges palace....well worth it, and i dont like museums much DO try and speak a little Italian... i was appauled at how most fellow brits and Yanks could not be bothered to try even a little hello/please/thankyou. We are both useless but did have a go as we were after all in Italy and not America!!! A little effort goes a long way here. Finally do get engaged as we did!!! looking at the bridge of sighs..followed by a cocktail in Harrys bar....who could say NO!!! thankyou for the best timeX

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and room were nicely decorated. Front desk service was very helpful. The only down-side was the room was rather small and there were mosquitos in our room.

Reviews.Title: “SO INCREDIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our trip the most incredible experience. The pictures don't even do it justice. It is right on a canal, just a 5 minute walk from Piazza San Marco, and in the best area of Venice. The staff was so incredible and helpful. They even gave tips about haggling gondola prices. Also, our stay included a free speed boat ride to Murano, the island where they make Venetian glass, and that was one of the highlights of our trip. Of course you have to pay a public boat to get back, but it is only 3 euro. The room was so clean, and stocked with a mini bar each night. The rooms and hotel had an amazing vanilla smell each day, and each morning I woke up to the smell of breakfast being cooked, which was good by the way. I felt so safe there, and clean. Had no hesitation about walking around barefoot. Also, our room had a canal view which was so enchanting with the men on gondolas going by singing, and tourists taking pictures of me out my window, thinking I was one of the Italian women, maybe...When I come back to Venice, this will be the hotel I stay in again. I loved it, and it is in THE BEST area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Youngblood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights the end of February, beginning of March 2005. We were in Venice celebrating our honeymoon. We loved our stay at the hotel. They put us in Room 105. There was a small balcony overlooking a canal. We were a minutes walk from San Marco. The hotel was clean. The staff spoke great English. The maids did a wonderful job cleaning our room every day. Breakfast was good. The bathroom a bit small, but not too small. It had a tub and a towel warmer rack. More than anything, the room was like a dream come true. There was complimentary champagne for us to assist in our celebrating. If we wanted breakfast in bed all we had to do was call the front desk. Honestly, it was the nicest, cleanest hotel we've stayed at in all of our travels to Italy. You can't beat the location, the cleanliness and the helpfulness of the staff. One word of advice, ask the front desk what restaurants to AVOID close to the hotel. We failed to do this and we got ripped off by a place down the street. As soon as we told the staff what happened to us, they knew what we were talking about. I wish I remembered the name of the place. But, the staff knows. We will not stay anywhere other than San Moise when visiting Venice in the future. The price is more than reasonable for what you get. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jazz007
Reviews.Content: Date - March 9-11, 2005 Reviewer: solo traveler from Charlottesville, VA The Hotel San Moise was a wonderful place to stay! I felt safe, it was quiet, and the room was very comfortable and luxurious. The Venetian glass chandeliers were gorgeous. The desk manager made me a reservation for a walking tour of San Marco that starts in front of the Royal Gardens, and I highly recommend this tour. The guide spoke beautiful English and was easy to understand. They also recommended a good nearby restaurant called Vino Vino, which was reasonably priced, the food was good, and they make a great bellini, a drink made from champagne and peaches. The breakfast was excellent, with plenty of food to eat. I loved the view of the canal and ancient buildings. I want to go back to Venice again just to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and so helpful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi (two couples) and that was an experience in itself.Our reception was really welcoming and helpful. Our rooms(double Superior) had views over a canal and this was entertaing at almost all times.Traffic ranged from Gondolas to trade deliveries and was always interesting and unobtrusive. Rooms well equipped, ornately fitted and comfortable. We shall go again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of all expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The helpful service and English speaking staff are faultless. Breakfast is plentiful and FULL! Perfect site, quiet yet only a few steps from San Marco and the waterbuses. Room beautiful with Venian furnishings clean and warm, way better than home! Loved the entrance via the little inner couryard. A magic place and had a terrific stay thanks to a fantastic hotel. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay at the Hotel San Moise and cannot fault the hotel in any way. Our room was spotlessly clean and very well maintained with a fabulous view of the canal with passing gondolas adding to the hotel's charm. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good with plenty of choice for every taste. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is just a short walk from Saint Mark's Square, but down a side alley making it very quiet and peaceful. The hotel building itself is very old and picturesque and authentically Venetian, with Murano glass chandeliers in the public areas as well as in the room. Overall an excellent choice of hotel and we would definitely return and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were able to secure this hotel rather cheaply and we loved it. The proximity to the Square was awesome and they had a great breakfast spread. Definintely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A new favourite !”
Reviews.Author: Britten
Reviews.Content: A convenient, secluded and reasonably priced piece of Venetian splendour. Our room, with it's waterside balcony, was a delight. Pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lover the Hotel San MoisÃ¨!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant time at the Hotel San MoisÃ¨. I can recommend it to anyone looking for a quality hotel right in the heart of San Marco. Our host Gianluca Serra was very friendly and helpful pointing out all the great places to see and the hotel provides a complilentary motor launch ride to Murano where all the great glass work comes from. Beautiful old antiques in your room, amazing ambience and luxurious bathrooms. I would recommed this hotel to any of my friends as THE place to stay in Venice; John A. Southern Melbourne, AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a short walk from San Marco. Front entrance faces a back lane, so need to keep a look out for the sign when first arriving at hotel. Lukewarm reception. At 180 euros a night for a twin, thought that it was pricey, but it could be pretty standard for Venice. Room was clean and quiet. Would stay there again, but would try and shop around for a cheaper place first.
